Title: Junior Data Engineer - Data Products
Description:
Scopo e attività




La figura ricercata, in qualità di DATA ENGINEER, dovrà progettare e sviluppare i software applicativi e le relative componenti dati, massimizzandone la qualità e la performance nel rispetto delle specifiche tecniche e funzionali definite, a stretto contatto con il team progettuale e funzionale dell’ambito applicativo di riferimento, supportandoli nella scelta delle migliori opzioni tecnologiche al fine di rendere efficienti e stabili gli ambiti applicativi.

Collaborerà all’interno del team di progetto con i responsabili che gestiscono gli aspetti progettuali e funzionali dell’ambito, supportandoli nella scelta delle migliori opzioni tecnologiche e soluzioni architetturali al fine di rendere efficienti e stabili gli ambiti applicativi in oggetto. Parteciperà alla fase di rilascio nel rispetto delle pianificazioni e qualità dei rilasci.

Lavorerai all’interno dell’area Group Technology del Gruppo Intesa Sanpaolo, nel Domain Data.

Le principali attività:

Conduzione o partecipazione alla gestione di progetti trasformativi basati sui dati
Progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni software innovative in modalità batch e near-real time, su ambienti tecnologici on premise e cloud
Mantenimento della coerenza tra quanto sviluppato e gli standard aziendali
Mantenimento della coerenza tra quanto sviluppato e la normativa aziendale con particolare riferimento alla Cybersecurity, alla Privacy, al Change Management e al Data Management
Coordinamento degli sviluppi delle varie progettualità
Esecuzione attività di analisi tecnica
Definizione e controllo linee guida di sviluppo
Individuare le linee strategiche di evoluzione, progettare ed evolvere le applicazioni presenti all’interno dell’ecosistema del Domain Data
Collaborazione con il Project Manager per la definizione dello Stato Avanzamento Lavori, identificazione e indirizzamento delle criticità, identificazione e gestione proattiva dei rischi di progetto
Analisi e valutazione dei rischi di progetto per individuare azioni a mitigazione degli stessi
Progettazione e realizzazione dei presidi di data governance e data quality in linea con le linee guida aziendali
Partecipazione alle fasi di progettazione, preparazione ed esecuzione dei test tecnici e funzionali
Partecipazione alle fasi di User Acceptance Test
Gestione della relazione con altri membri del team interno ed esterno di sviluppo




Esperienza Richiesta




Sono richiesti almeno 2-3 anni di esperienza in progetti IT in ambito dati, a media o alta complessità, preferibilmente nel contesto bancario, finanziario o settore creditizio.

Esperienza nella gestione delle dinamiche di gruppo tipiche di progetti di grandi dimensioni con diversi stakeholder e team di lavoro geograficamente distribuiti.




Esperienza,Competenze,Skill e Qualifiche richieste




Laurea Triennale o Magistrale in discipline STEM
Livello ‘fluent’ di conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata
Conoscenza delle architetture delle basi dati
Conoscenza dei modelli di integrazione nell’ambito del sistema informativo
Conoscenza della progettazione di Datawarehouse
Conoscenza delle tecnologie di data transformation
Conoscenza delle tecnologie di data communication
Conoscenza dei principali db SQL
Conoscenza dei principali db NOSQL
Conoscenza di architetture a microservizi
Conoscenza dei sistemi di versionamento del software
Conoscenza del processo e degli strumenti di Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivey e Continuous Deployment del DevOps
Conoscenza DataOps
Conoscenza dei sistemi di workflow
Conoscenza Apache Hadoop
Conoscenza Teradata
Conoscenza Oracle
Conoscenza Google BigQuery
Conoscenza PostgreSQL
Conoscenza dei processi IT
Conoscenza dei processi di produzione del software
Conoscenza della metodologia di sviluppo Agile Scrum
Conoscenza delle metodologie di Data Quality
Conoscenza delle metodologie di Data Governance
Conoscenza degli ambienti cloud: Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure
Conoscenza dei principali sistemi operativi




Requisiti preferenziali (plus):




Conoscenza dei sistemi di sintesi in ambito bancario, finanziario o settore creditizio
Competenza in progetti IT con l’utilizzo dello strumento ALM Quality Center
Competenza in progetti IT in ambienti Google Cloud Platform
Competenza in progetti IT con l’utilizzo dello strumento di versionamento GIT e IBM Rational Team Concert
Competenza Java in ambito enterprise
Competenza in progetti IT con utilizzo dei framework: SAS, Python, R
Conoscenza Apache Spark
Conoscenza PySpark
Conoscenza algoritmi di AI
Conoscenza algoritmi di AIGen




Chi siamo




Siamo leader in Italia e uno dei principali gruppi bancari in Europa. Unisciti a noi e fai parte della nostra storia di successo! Con oltre 20 milioni di clienti in Italia e all'estero siamo un vero e proprio motore di crescita sostenibile con un forte impegno per l'ambiente e un impatto tangibile sulla società.

Le persone sono al centro, ce ne prendiamo cura impegnandoci nel creare una cultura inclusiva all'interno del Gruppo in cui tutti si sentano protagonisti e valorizzati.




Unisciti alla nostra realtà internazionale. Il futuro non si aspetta, si sceglie!

#sharingfuture

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

Per l'headquarter di Milano ricerchiamo un/a:

                                                                                                   Data Analyst 

La risorsa, inserita all’interno del Dipartimento Corporate Product Master, si occuperà di coordinare e svolgere le attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate dell’area di competenza, in collaborazione con tutte le funzioni coinvolte. 

Principali attività:


Analisi delle caratteristiche di prodotto, creazione anagrafica del prodotto stesso sui vari sistemi in uso nel Gruppo.
Coordinamento con le funzioni coinvolte nel processo di definizione e costificazione del prodotto.
Attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate (divulgare il processo e le procedure relative al PIM, analisi della situazione anagrafica locale, verifica discrepanze con anagrafica Corporate, sistemazione delle anomalie, ecc)
Analisi EDI per il processo di data exchange, per identificare mancanze e soluzioni, ed eventualmente rimodellare i dati di gestione Mapei affinché il processo possa svilupparsi verso terze parti in maniera lineare
In ambito E-commerce worldwide, l'attività prevede lo studio delle regole internazionali di interscambio dati; l'analisi, la preparazione e l'interfacciamento di tutti i dati di catalogo, in modo da automatizzare il processo di comunicazione da e verso Clienti/Fornitori.


Requisiti richiesti:


Laurea in Informatica, Ing, Gestionale, Economia, Statistica, Matematica
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 3-5 anni in ruoli di Data Analyst
Ottima conoscenza di Excel, Power Query, Power Point, Power BI, Power Pivot
Conoscenze di project management e/o gestionale per co-ordinamento attività roll-out
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Disponibilità a trasferte
Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilità, precisione, team working, analisi, organizzazione e coordinamento


Ulteriori informazioni:


Contratto: da valutare in base alla seniority del candidato.
Sede di lavoro: Milano


Filosofia aziendale: 


Innovazione e specializzazione 
Internazionalizzazione 
Sostenibilità sociale e ambientale
Persone al centro
Pari opportunità e inclusione


Benefits:


Formazione continua e sviluppo
Welfare aziendale
Fondi CCNL (Assicurazione sanitaria e pensionistica)
Convenzioni aziendali 


Chi siamo:

Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

                                                 MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

L’azienda garantisce il trattamento dei dati ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo n. 2016/679, rinviando all’informativa privacy disponibile proseguendo con la presente candidatura. La ricerca è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi.  (L. 903/77). 

Esplora le Opportunità di carriera sul sito www.mapei.com

  • Coordinamento con le funzioni coinvolte nel processo di definizione e costificazione del prodotto.
  • Attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate (divulgare il processo e le procedure relative al PIM, analisi della situazione anagrafica locale, verifica discrepanze con anagrafica Corporate, sistemazione delle anomalie, ecc)
  • Analisi EDI per il processo di data exchange, per identificare mancanze e soluzioni, ed eventualmente rimodellare i dati di gestione Mapei affinché il processo possa svilupparsi verso terze parti in maniera lineare
  • In ambito E-commerce worldwide, l'attività prevede lo studio delle regole internazionali di interscambio dati; l'analisi, la preparazione e l'interfacciamento di tutti i dati di catalogo, in modo da automatizzare il processo di comunicazione da e verso Clienti/Fornitori.


Requisiti richiesti:
  • Laurea in Informatica, Ing, Gestionale, Economia, Statistica, Matematica
  • Esperienza pregressa di almeno 3-5 anni in ruoli di Data Analyst
  • Ottima conoscenza di Excel, Power Query, Power Point, Power BI, Power Pivot
  • Conoscenze di project management e/o gestionale per co-ordinamento attività roll-out
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Disponibilità a trasferte
  • Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilità, precisione, team working, analisi, organizzazione e coordinamento


Ulteriori informazioni:
  • Contratto: da valutare in base alla seniority del candidato.
  • Sede di lavoro: Milano


Filosofia aziendale: 
  • Innovazione e specializzazione 
  • Internazionalizzazione 
  • Sostenibilità sociale e ambientale
  • Persone al centro
  • Pari opportunità e inclusione


Benefits:
  • Formazione continua e sviluppo
  • Welfare aziendale
  • Fondi CCNL (Assicurazione sanitaria e pensionistica)
  • Convenzioni aziendali 


Chi siamo:

Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

                                                 MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

L’azienda garantisce il trattamento dei dati ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo n. 2016/679, rinviando all’informativa privacy disponibile proseguendo con la presente candidatura. La ricerca è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi.  (L. 903/77). 

Esplora le Opportunità di carriera sul sito www.mapei.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Mollie, we’re on a mission to make payments and money management effortless for every business in Europe. We started 20 years ago when we launched a more direct, affordable way for companies to get paid. That provided an alternative to the frustrating, overpriced solutions that banks offered at the time.

Today, we serve more than 250,000 businesses across Europe with an all-in-one solution that simplifies payments and money management. And we’re a 850-strong team of product, finance, support, commerce, and engineering specialists working across Europe – from Lisbon to London.

Your Opportunity

We're looking for an experienced and motivated Data Analyst to lead the analytical efforts of our Real-time Fraud Monitoring Team.

Working within one of Mollie's newest verticals, our team is dedicated to protecting our account holders from financial crimes. We're on the front lines, developing scalable, automated risk decision-making tools that operate in milliseconds. Here, real-time data meets real-world security.

This role isn't just about technical expertise; it's about addressing critical business challenges. You'll use your technical skills to design, build, and optimise intricate data pipelines and analytical solutions for fraud detection. You'll work with Mollie's complex, real-time data flows, transforming raw data into actionable insights that directly combat financial crime and enable swift risk decisions.

You'll play a key role in driving impactful solutions from concept to deployment, partnering closely with our engineering, product, and operations teams to ensure our analytical capabilities are seamlessly integrated. Your efforts will directly contribute to protecting our account holders, turning data into the shield that safeguards our business.

What You’ll Do


Data product development: Build and maintain robust, performant, easy-to-use data products and dashboards to monitor key fraud metrics and help us make decisions
Data analysis & interpretation: Analyse merchant behaviour and transaction data to detect patterns, anomalies, and potential fraud indicators to inform Mollie's risk strategy.
Data visualisation & storytelling: Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to effectively communicate your findings to technical and non-technical audiences using various mediums, e.g. presentations, reports, memos, etc.
Documentation & knowledge sharing: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data products, processes, and analyses to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding of new team members.
Data quality assurance: Implement data quality checks and processes to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data used for analysis and decision-making.
Experimentation & prototyping: Develop and test new analytical approaches and models through experimentation and prototyping to improve fraud detection and risk assessment.


What You Bring


Proven experience in analytics within a complex risk, fintech, or payments environment
Strong technical foundation in SQL and Python; experience with data modelling and automation
Deep understanding of one or more risk areas: fraud, AML/CFT, credit risk
Experience leading analysts or analytics engineers, with a track record of raising the bar
Ability to zoom out and to zoom in to support implementation, often on the same day
Skilled at stakeholder management, especially across technical and non-technical teams
Business-aware, impact-driven, and curious
Show more

Title: Addetto/a centro studi - dati
Description:
Adecco Team Explora è alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire all'interno di un'associazione di categoria con il ruolo di Addetto/a centro studi - dati. La figura si occuperà principalmente di raccolta, gestione e analisi di dati relativi al mercato e alle influenze politiche globali che impattano i settori dei clienti (acciaio, raccolta metalli, serramenta, alluminio e altri comparti affini).

Responsabilità principali:

Raccolta ed elaborazione di dati economici e di mercato.
Organizzazione strutturata e dettagliata dei dati raccolti.
Analisi dei trend e delle possibili implicazioni politiche ed economiche a supporto delle attività aziendali.
In una fase successiva, a seguito di formazione interna, possibilità di contribuire alla redazione di reportistica e presentazioni destinate ai clienti.

Requisiti richiesti:

Laurea in discipline economiche e/o statistiche.
Buona capacità di analisi e interpretazione dei dati in chiave economico-politica.
Attitudine al lavoro strutturato e alla gestione di informazioni complesse nel tempo.
Disponibilità a rare trasferte in Italia ed all’estero.

Inquadramento contrattuale:

Contratto a tempo determinato di 12 mesi con prospettiva di successiva stabilizzazione a tempo indeterminato, CCNL Commercio

Orario di lavoro: full time, lunedì-venerdì

Luogo di lavoro: Milano (zona metro Dateo-Susa)

Cosa offrono:

Percorso di formazione specifico sul settore e sul contesto operativo.
Opportunità di crescita professionale in un ambiente dinamico e di respiro internazionale.

Possibilità di acquisire competenze trasversali nell’analisi dei mercati e nell’interpretazione delle dinamiche politico-economiche globali.







I candidati, nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006, D.lgs 215/2003 e D.lgs 216/2003, sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy consultabile sotto il form di richiesta dati della pagina di candidatura (Regolamento UE n. 2016/679).

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.200 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.

Siamo alla ricerca di profili junior entusiasti e motivati da inserire nella nostra Business Unit specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni di Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence e Big Data.

Percorso Formativo: Durante lo stage, i tirocinanti seguiranno un percorso formativo strutturato per fornire competenze tecniche e professionali nel settore IT.

Di seguito una panoramica delle principali fasi:

Studio Teorico:


Sistemi di basi dati e modelli relazionali
Linguaggi di programmazione: .NET 2012, C#, Python
Introduzione ai concetti di Data Warehouse e Business Intelligence
Fondamenti di Statistica inferenziale e Machine Learning
Approccio conoscitivo all'AI generativa



Autoapprendimento:


Accesso a libri, corsi online e video training
Esercitazioni pratiche e quiz di autovalutazione



Contestualizzazione Funzionale:


Apprendimento pratico tramite progetti reali
Utilizzo di tecnologie come Windows Server, SQL Server, MongoDB, Visual Code, Visual Studio e strumenti di BI come Power BI



Lavoro in Team:


Interfacciamento con un team e un referente di progetto
Partecipazione a meeting di stato avanzamento lavori



Requisiti necessari:


Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale o Informatica (indirizzo Data Science/Machine Learning)
Conoscenza teorica di basi dati e modelli relazionali
Utilizzo avanzato del pacchetto MS Office (Excel, Word)
Dedizione allo studio e forte volontà di apprendere



Cosa offriamo:


Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante
Opportunità di crescita professionale
Supporto costante da parte di un supervisore esperto
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti innovativi e di alto impatto



Modalità di lavoro: in Presenza su Milano.

Contratto: tirocinio retribuito di 6 mesi finalizzato all’assunzione.

Se sei appassionato di IT e desideri iniziare la tua carriera in una realtà dinamica e innovativa, inviaci il tuo CV, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679) e riportando nell'oggetto il riferimento all'annuncio.
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The candidate will play a crucial role in managing and analyzing data for our Claims Department, providing support to the Performance Monitoring Unit and contributing to the full spectrum of claims processes. Your expertise in reporting will be essential in assisting the Business Managers in making informed decisions. We are looking for a talented and proactive individual with strong skills in collaboration. This person should be able to work closely with various Units within the Claims Department, as well as with other teams in our Company, our Group Headquarters, and other Allianz Operating Entities around the world

Key Responsibilities


Design and implement a management controlling system to monitor and track ordinary business and strategic project initiatives.
Monitor the results of initiatives and assess their impact on financial statements.
Collaborate with other Units within the Claims Department and global operating entities to deploy the initiatives of the Plan.
Update and revise priorities listed in the Plan based on observed results of initiatives.
Suggest additional initiatives to ensure the achievement of targets identified in the Plan.
Coordinate reporting preparation and updates at the Allianz Group level


Key Requirements/Skills/Experience


Master's degree in Economics, Business, Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in a consultancy environment (previous experience in Planning & Controlling, M&A, Data Analytics or equivalent will be considered a plus).
Proactive approach in collaborating with other business functions and Group Headquarters.
Excellent knowledge of:

SAS application platform, particularly SAS Base and SAS Macro programming languages and the Output Delivery System (ODS) module
Microsoft Office™ tools and VBA programming language.
SQL language
Power BI and reporting platforms
Celonis software and process mining analysis
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.


75562 | Customer Services & Claims | Entry Level | [[custPositionClusterCSB]] | Allianz Italy | Full Time or Part Time | Permanent

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

At Allianz, we stand for unity: we believe that a united world is a more prosperous world, and we are dedicated to consistently advocating for equal opportunities for all. And the foundation for this is our inclusive workplace, where people and performance both matter, and nurtures a culture grounded in integrity, fairness, inclusion and trust.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

Title: Data & BI Analyst
HTML:
Descrizione del messaggio

Data & BI Analyst

Sei interessata/o allo sviluppo di progetti strategici e consulenziali in ambito data analysis, business intelligence e intelligenza artificiale?

Questa è una fantastica opportunità per un giovane professionista che desidera entrare a far parte di un ambiente di lavoro collaborativo e dinamico, con la possibilità di lavorare con un team altamente specializzato e stakeholder di alto profilo.

L’Innovation Hub è parte del team Affinity, Mobility & DCS, dedicato allo sviluppo di soluzioni innovative e ad alto valore aggiunto per le diverse aree di business del mondo Motor. Attraverso l’adozione di tecnologie avanzate, tra cui strumenti di intelligenza artificiale, l’hub gestisce progetti volti a ottimizzare processi e attività aziendali. L’area Mobility/Mobility Innovation Hub ti offrirà un percorso formativo nel mondo della consulenza e della gestione dei dati, con ampie possibilità di crescita professionale.

Si tratta di un ruolo ibrido che può offrire la flessibilità di lavorare in parte virtualmente e in parte presso la nostra sede di Milano.

Aon is the business of better decisions.

In Aon, diamo forma alle decisioni migliori per proteggere e arricchire la vita delle persone in tutto il mondo. Siamo un’organizzazione fondata sulla fiducia reciproca e sulla diversità, aiutiamo con passione i nostri colleghi e clienti ad avere successo.

Come sarà la giornata tipo?

Il Data & BI Analyst è la figura che supporta l’area Mobility/Mobility Innovation Hub nella gestione e valorizzazione dei dati, contribuendo all’efficienza operativa e alla qualità delle decisioni aziendali.

Attività Svolte

  • Gestione dei flussi informativi da e verso stakeholder interni (IT, Business Unit) ed esterni (Clienti, Compagnie);
  • Creazione di analisi e dashboard per la visualizzazione e condivisione dei dati;
  • Orchestrazione e automazione dei processi di ingestion, data cleaning e normalizzazione in collaborazione con i team IT;
  • Supporto all’adozione di soluzioni basate su intelligenza artificiale per l’analisi predittiva e l’ottimizzazione dei processi.

Quali sono le competenze ed esperienze richieste?

  • Laureandi/Laurea triennale e/o magistrale in discipline STEM, economiche o affini;
  • Esperienza pregressa (anche breve) in ambito data analysis o BI costituisce un plus;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei principali pacchetti Office (in particolare Excel e PowerPoint);
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di BI (es. Power BI, Tableau) e linguaggi di elaborazione dati (es. SQL, Python);
  • Conoscenza di base o interesse per strumenti di intelligenza artificiale e machine learning è considerata un vantaggio;
  • Ottimo livello di inglese scritto e parlato;
  • Completano il profilo: curiosità, proattività, precisione, orientamento al risultato, buone capacità relazionali e organizzative, attitudine al team working.

Come supportiamo i nostri colleghi?

La nostra organizzazione aperta ed inclusiva consente, grazie all’approccio agile e alla modalità di lavoro ibrida, di gestire l'equilibrio tra lavoro e vita privata assicurando ad ogni collega di poter dare il meglio di sé. Inoltre, annualmente sono previsti due "Global Wellbeing Days", in modo da poter dedicare del tempo al proprio benessere.

La nostra cultura sostiene un ambiente di lavoro innovativo e diversificato in cui tutti i colleghi, sentendosi sé stessi, sono ispirati e motivati ad imparare, condividere e sviluppare le proprie competenze.

Sede di lavoro: Milano, Via Ernesto Calindri 6.

2564892

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez,
Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN,
Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions.
Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Starcasino
Description:
Location: Grimbergen

Employment type: Full-time




About Us

Welcome to Starcasino – Pioneers in Casino Entertainment

With over 30 years of experience, Starcasino is a leading, family-owned Belgian company in the casino and iGaming industry. Our brands—including Starcasino.be, Hotwin.be, Solcasino.es, and Starcasino.nl—are well known across Belgium, Spain, and the Netherlands. With more than 10 physical locations and a vibrant online presence, we're always looking for fresh energy to support our mission of delivering next-level gaming experiences.




The Role

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our data & insights team. Your primary responsibility will be to support business stakeholders with clear and actionable insights using Metabase. You'll play a key role in helping our teams make smarter decisions based on real data.




What You’ll Do

Create and maintain dashboards and reports in Metabase
Work closely with marketing, product, and operations teams to provide insights and performance tracking
Analyze customer behavior, campaign performance, and platform trends
Assist in A/B testing and experiment evaluation
Ensure data quality and help optimize internal reporting processes




What We’re Looking For

A degree in a relevant field (e.g. statistics, computer science, economics, or related)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with Metabase (personal projects or internships are welcome)
Good knowledge of SQL
Eagerness to learn, ask questions, and grow within a data-driven environment
Fluent in English; Dutch or French is a plus
Must be based in Belgium and able to work in our office in Grimbergen




What We Offer

A dynamic and collaborative work environment in a growing industry
Competitive salary package with benefits
Full training and guidance from our marketing team.
A look behind the scenes of a fast-growing international company.
Work on-site in Grimbergen, with:
Free lunch every day
Unlimited snacks & drinks
A young, dynamic, and welcoming team




Ready to join the game?

Want to gain real-world data analyst experience and build your portfolio? Join our team and help shape the voice of Starcasino!

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualisation
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

Who We Are

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

The Opportunity

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.

Responsibilities


Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization


Your Profile


Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills; ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.
Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.


What We Offer


Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.


Why Join Us?

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Are you a talented Data Analyst looking to take the next step in your career?

Amaris Consulting is seeking a motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Belgium. This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals with a keen analytical mindset, technical expertise, and strong communication skills to grow and make an impact in a dynamic, multicultural environment.




🔥 Your Role:

Analyze data and create reports to help the business make decisions.
Build dashboards and visualizations to share insights.
Work with different teams to understand their data needs.
Make sure data is accurate and clean.
Present your findings to both technical and non-technical people.




🎯Your Profile:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Good knowledge of SQL and data analysis tools (like Python or R).
Experience with data visualization tools (like Power BI or Tableau).
Team player with good communication skills.
Speak English and Dutch (bilingual) or English, French, and Dutch (trilingual).




🚀 Advantages:

An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.




💡 We are an independent company that values:

Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.







Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🔎 Freelance Data Analyst | Brussels (50% Remote) | Start September | Long-Term Project 🔎

📍 Location: Brussels, Belgium (50% Remote)

🗓️ Start: September 2025

🧾 Contract: Freelance (PO of 5 years)

🌍 Languages: French, Dutch & English (trilingual preferred)

💼 Sector: Public Sector / Business Intelligence

We’re hiring a freelance Data Analyst for a major BI program with a long-term vision. You’ll work in a multilingual environment on strategic analytics initiatives that support operational and business decision-making.

🎯 Your Role

As a Data Analyst, you will:

Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and insights.
Build clear and maintainable data models to support business objectives.
Design impactful dashboards and reports using Power BI (or equivalent).
Collaborate on the setup of data governance practices and modeling standards.
Translate business needs into actionable data deliverables and visual stories.

Bonus points for experience with: Git, CI/CD, unit testing, or data mesh principles.

🛠️ Key Skills Required

Power BI or equivalent BI tools – 5+ years
Microsoft SQL Server / MS Fabric DWH – 5+ years
Advanced SQL & data modeling – 5+ years
Data governance and modeling frameworks – 5+ years

🤝 What We’re Looking For

Strong understanding of IT ecosystems and data-centric organizations
Excellent communication, storytelling, and stakeholder engagement skills
Able to work in a team with shared values: positivity, reliability, courage, and collaboration
Professionalism and commitment to long-term project success

💬 Languages

Trilingual: French, Dutch, and English preferred (written & spoken)

Long-term freelance opportunity (5-year PO)
50% remote flexibility

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LACO is geen doorsnee IT-bedrijf. We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data & AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data & AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons écht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten én collega’s en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.




🛠️ Wat je gaat doen:

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven écht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega’s uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.




🎯 Wat wij zoeken:

Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.




Extra punten als je ook …

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.




💡 Wat wij bieden:

Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, …
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt — wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden …




📩 Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?

Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje – ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

We horen graag van je!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Our Reward Team helps clients navigate the total reward landscape in a tailor-made and result-oriented way. From developing rewards strategy to implementing innovative solutions, they bring together the right mix of expertise—covering everything from reward, tax & legal, employee communication, to tech and processes.

Role Summary

In today’s reward landscape, data and analytics are becoming central drivers of change. Pay transparency and pay equity are rapidly gaining importance, accelerated by global legislation and the upcoming EU Pay Transparency Directive. At Deloitte, we help our clients prepare for these changes and achieve fair, transparent and effective reward strategies.

As a Rewards Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in this journey. Working as part of our multidisciplinary Global Employer Services (GES) reward team—which brings together experts in job architecture, job grading, tax & social security, people law, compensation, benefits, processes and reward technology—you will help clients translate complex data into meaningful insights and actionable solutions.

We Are Looking For Both Junior And Senior Profiles


Junior Data Analyst: you will focus on preparing and executing analyses, supporting senior colleagues in delivering client-ready outputs.
Senior Data Analyst: in addition to performing analyses, you will review the work of junior colleagues, engage directly with clients, and contribute to shaping client deliverables and recommendations.


Key Responsibilities

Junior Data Analyst


Prepare reward and compensation datasets for analysis, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Conduct statistical and regression analyses under the guidance of senior colleagues.
Develop dashboards and visualisations (Power BI, R, Python) to support client discussions.
Draft initial reports and presentations for senior review.
Support the implementation of pay equity & transparency analyses.


Senior Data Analyst


Lead the design and execution of advanced reward analytics projects.
Review and validate analyses prepared by junior colleagues, ensuring quality and accuracy.
Translate findings into clear insights and recommendations for clients.
Engage directly with clients to present results and provide advice on next steps.
Act as a key contributor within Deloitte’s pay equity & transparency offering, helping clients adapt to evolving legislation (incl. EU Pay Transparency Directive).


Let’s Talk About You!


Strong interest to bring advanced analytics (and artificial intelligence) into our client solutions & applications
At least 1 - 3 years (junior profile) or 4 - 6 years (senior profile) of experience in data analytics
Experience in applying statistical techniques
Experience working with R or Python and Power BI (or other data visualisation tools)
Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably one additional language (Dutch or French)
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and data visualisation tools


Our story

Global Employer Services (GES) team is fully aware today’s digital revolution is rapidly rewriting the environment for employers and their global workforces. The need for mobility is greater than ever. We help our clients achieve control, gain perspective, and lead with confidence through this period of uncertainty and technological change. Our professionals focus on providing personal tax, compensation & benefits and international assignment/HR services to our clients. We assist our clients to streamline their HR, Mobility and Rewards programs, while managing tax effectiveness, compliance and employment costs, both in a global and domestic context.

Reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll advisory designed just for you! Our professionals help you design cost-effective, tax-efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs.

Our story - Global Employer Services (GES)

In today's digital revolution, the environment for employers and their (global) workforces is rapidly evolving, with an increased need for adaptability. The GES team is dedicated to helping clients navigate these challenges with confidence, providing expertise in rewards, compensation & benefits, personal tax and international assignment/HR services.

Our focus is on streamlining HR, Rewards and Mobility programs to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and cost management in both global and domestic contexts. We offer specialised advisory services in reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.

Our professionals are committed to designing cost-effective, efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs. We are here to support your journey towards pay transparency and equity, ensuring your compensation strategies are both attractive to employees and beneficial for your business.

Why work in GES?


Passion: Driven by a love for mobility, payroll, and rewards services, crafting both local and global solutions in a sustainable way.
People-focused: Working with and for people. Investing in coaching, learning, and developing the team, making sure everyone grows.
Professionalism: Delivering excellence as a united team, ensuring success for their clients and for each other.


Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:


My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities


Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality


Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Graphic Packaging International, we produce the paper cup that held your coffee this morning, the basket that transported those bottles of craft beer you enjoyed last weekend, and the microwave tray that heated your gourmet meal last night. We’re one of the largest manufacturers of paperboard and paper-based packaging for some of the world’s most recognised brands of food, beverage, food service, household, personal care and pet products. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, we are collaborative, diverse, innovative individuals who create inspired packaging while giving back to our communities.




With over 25,000 employees working in more than 130 locations worldwide, we strive to be environmentally responsible in our industry and in the communities where we operate. We are committed to workplace diversity and offer compensation and benefits programs that are among the industry’s best to reward the talented people who make our company successful.

A World of Difference. Made Possible.




Job Purpose

As an Aurora Data Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting the Aurora program by coordinating the extraction, transformation, and migration of master and transactional data from legacy systems into Aurora Radius. You’ll work closely with local sites, external vendors, and internal teams to ensure data integrity and seamless integration. Your deep understanding of GPI’s business processes will be essential in translating operational needs into effective data solutions.




Are you passionate about data, systems integration, and making a real impact in business transformation? Join our dynamic team as an Aurora Data Analyst and help shape the future of our data landscape!




🔍 What You’ll Do

As part of the Aurora program, you’ll:

Coordinate data extraction and transformation from legacy systems.
Lead ETL processes and final data migration during go-live.
Collaborate with local sites, vendors, and internal teams to ensure accurate data loads into Aurora Radius.
Work hands-on with transactional data: Sales Orders, Purchase Orders, Inventory, WIP.
Travel to sites during rollout phases to support data conversion and cutover.
Ensure all processes are documented and audit-compliant.

📊 Your Impact

Deliver accurate, timely Power BI reports.
Improve data accessibility and quality across departments.
Automate manual reporting processes.
Ensure seamless integration of new data sources.

🧠 What You Bring

Advanced ETL and SQL skills.
Experience with relational databases and large datasets.
Knowledge of manufacturing and business processes.
Familiarity with Power Apps and Xlink tools.
Strong communication and problem-solving abilities.
Willingness to travel and support go-live activities on-site.

🤝 Who You Are

Self-motivated and reliable.
Quality and safety conscious.
Collaborative and eager to learn.
Excellent communicator with a strong work ethic.







What We Offer

Joining our team means becoming part of a forward-thinking organization where your skills and ideas truly matter. As an Aurora Data Analyst, you’ll enjoy:

✅ Competitive Compensation – A salary package that reflects your experience and impact.

✅ Growth Opportunities – Access to training, certifications, and career development within a global transformation program.

✅ Collaborative Culture – Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment.

✅ Travel & Exposure – Be part of a high-visibility project with opportunities to travel and engage directly with local sites.

✅ Work-Life Balance – Flexible working arrangements where possible, with recognition of your time and commitment during go-live phases.

✅ Cutting-Edge Tools – Work with modern technologies like Power BI, SQL, Power Apps, and Radius.







Ready to make a difference? Apply now and be part of a trans formative journey with the Aurora program!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong expertise in data warehousing and modelling to support data-driven initiatives within a banking environment. The analyst will work closely with business stakeholders, architects, and delivery teams to translate complex business needs into reliable and scalable data solutions.




Responsibilities:

Analyse and challenge business requirements and translate them into structured functional and technical specifications
Collaborate with Solution Architects to ensure alignment with existing data architecture
Model and document data structures using 3NF and dimensional modelling (Kimball methodology)
Support the design, validation, and optimisation of ETL processes
Conduct impact analysis and formulate clear solution proposals
Maintain consistent and structured documentation of requirements, models, and solutions
Support testing and validation activities (e.g. defect analysis, UAT follow-up)
Contribute to knowledge sharing, peer reviews, and team improvement efforts
Actively participate in Agile ceremonies (e.g. sprint planning, retrospectives)
Identify data-related risks and ensure compliance with internal governance and security standards




Profile:

Master’s degree (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or functional analyst in a complex environment
Deep knowledge of data modelling techniques: 3NF, Kimball/star schema (facts/dimensions)
Strong SQL skills and solid experience with ETL tools
Experience with Oracle and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) is a strong asset
Knowledge of Data Vault modelling is a plus
Able to work independently and provide structured input to project teams
Precise, analytical, and solution-focused approach
Fluent in Dutch (mandatory), with a good command of English or French




About Dynafin Consulting

DynaFin is a consulting company with 15 years of experience in delivering high quality services to one single sector: Financial Services. We have built a team of > 150 financial services experts in Belgium, Luxembourg and France, passionate to support the sustainable transformation of the financial industry.

DynaFin advises this key sector of the global economy to boost its operating performance and innovate for the future.




We provide unique and pragmatic solutions to address market challenges, bundled in 5 DynaFin core expertises:

• Business Model Innovation

• Enterprise Operating Performance

• Regulatory Compliance

• Risk Management

• Technology




Since 2017, DynaFin is part of Alan Allman Associates, a worldwide ecosystem of 20 strong brands specialized in strategy and digital transformation, representing 3.200 Consultants. AAA aims to bring together the expertise of its brands, allowing DynaFin to create integrated end to end services for our customers

The analyst will work closely with business stakeholders, architects, and delivery teams to translate complex business needs into reliable and scalable data solutions.


Responsibilities:

  • Analyse and challenge business requirements and translate them into structured functional and technical specifications
  • Collaborate with Solution Architects to ensure alignment with existing data architecture
  • Model and document data structures using 3NF and dimensional modelling (Kimball methodology)
  • Support the design, validation, and optimisation of ETL processes
  • Conduct impact analysis and formulate clear solution proposals
  • Maintain consistent and structured documentation of requirements, models, and solutions
  • Support testing and validation activities (e.g. defect analysis, UAT follow-up)
  • Contribute to knowledge sharing, peer reviews, and team improvement efforts
  • Actively participate in Agile ceremonies (e.g. sprint planning, retrospectives)
  • Identify data-related risks and ensure compliance with internal governance and security standards


Profile:

  • Master’s degree (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Economics)
  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or functional analyst in a complex environment
  • Deep knowledge of data modelling techniques: 3NF, Kimball/star schema (facts/dimensions)
  • Strong SQL skills and solid experience with ETL tools
  • Experience with Oracle and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) is a strong asset
  • Knowledge of Data Vault modelling is a plus
  • Able to work independently and provide structured input to project teams
  • Precise, analytical, and solution-focused approach
  • Fluent in Dutch (mandatory), with a good command of English or French


About Dynafin Consulting

DynaFin is a consulting company with 15 years of experience in delivering high quality services to one single sector: Financial Services. We have built a team of > 150 financial services experts in Belgium, Luxembourg and France, passionate to support the sustainable transformation of the financial industry.

DynaFin advises this key sector of the global economy to boost its operating performance and innovate for the future.


We provide unique and pragmatic solutions to address market challenges, bundled in 5 DynaFin core expertises:

• Business Model Innovation

• Enterprise Operating Performance

• Regulatory Compliance

• Risk Management

• Technology


Since 2017, DynaFin is part of Alan Allman Associates, a worldwide ecosystem of 20 strong brands specialized in strategy and digital transformation, representing 3.200 Consultants. AAA aims to bring together the expertise of its brands, allowing DynaFin to create integrated end to end services for our customers

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For thousands of years, MAPS have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a MAPS Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately, resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge, a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!

Ideal candidate


Fluent in English and Dutch.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Belgium.
Analytical mindset.


Job requirements


Must be living in Belgium for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, MAP applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.


Benefits


Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Apply online today!
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone’s effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.


Fincons is looking for a BUSINESS, PROCESS and DATA ANALYST


We are seeking a professional with a hybrid background in business analysis, data analytics, and service operations, capable of translating operational performance data into actionable business insights. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in supporting business operations through analytical frameworks, continuous service improvement, and structured governance.

Familiarity with ITSM practices remains essential, but the emphasis is on their application in business support environments, such as finance, HR, logistics, or customer service.


TASKS


Following tasks will be performed by external service provider:

• Understand the overall customs processes in order to be able to determine the required IT

requirements. More explicitly, the relationships between the customs business layer and the

IT service layer are of major importance;

• Prepare project plan, execute & follow-up, discuss and negotiate with all stakeholders

SoftDev, ITSM, internal teams etc.

• Participate and contribute in brainstorming, meetings, trainings and workshops with contractors and/or other partners;

• Organise and lead project-related meetings, including webinars, trainings, workshops

• Support projects by designing services and components (or supervising contractors' design),

encouraging re-use as well as committing that the design of the system will fulfil the

requirements;

• Define in close collaboration with the contractors and the systems’ stakeholders the

requirements, in particular non-functional requirements (volume, scalability,

confidentiality, integrity, availability, business continuity and disaster recovery planning);

• Analyse the integration of different information systems and ensure their interoperability;

• Produce and/or review project related documents (including Function Point reports).

• Discuss and coordinate business aspects of the assigned IT projects with various

stakeholders (DG TAXUD business and IT teams, contractors' teams, COTS providers,

Member States' representatives, etc.). Understanding of the applicable legislation, the

business and the functional requirements;

• Determine the IT requirements and translate them into an action and project plan;

• Enforce the delivery of the project(s) according to the agreed schedule, with the expected

quality and with the resources provided;

• Ensuring maximum uptime, accurate and early incident response, appropriate configuration

management, proactive maintenance and tuning;

• The monitoring and reporting on operations and on capacity consumption, and liaison with

all (internal and external) stakeholders;

• The definition of KPIs, as well as the monitoring and reporting on all quality indicators.

• Report on the service status (SLA, actions, risks, issues, decisions, changes, etc.)

• Follow-up of the activities of the DG TAXUD contractors:

o Support the preparation of technical annexes to setup the contractual activities;

o Coordinate project related matters with the contractors and other stakeholders;

o Supervise the production of the deliverables and the required level of quality;

o Review the periodically produced reports related to the assigned projects.

• Report on the project status (tasks progress, plan, actions, risks, issues, decisions, changes,

etc.).



REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE

• Minimum experience of 10 years in IT systems out of which 5 years within customs environment

performing systems analysis or project management activities;

• Deep IT technical knowledge in areas of networking (TCP/IP), Linux, databases, IT security,

programming languages and web based applications;

• Excellent knowledge of service interfaces and service data;

• Experience of large scale IT systems integration projects;

• Knowledge and experience in platforms like CCN1, CCN2 etc. is an asset;

• Experience with distributed IT systems is an asset;

• Prior experience with conformance testing is an asset;

• Ability to work autonomously is mandatory;

• Experience in international/multicultural environment and public administration are assets;

• Ability to give business and technical presentations

• Very good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences;

• Analysis and problem-solving skills;

• Capability to write clear and structured technical documents;

• Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills.


SPECIFIC EXPERTISE

• Oracle SQL developer;

• Soap UI and Ready API;

• ALM tools: Jira, Nexus, Confluence.


English (C1) required


Office: Brussels

modality of work: near-site


If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Title: Investment Data Analyst
Description:
Context

The Junior Investment Data Analyst is a member of the Investment Strategy Group (ISG) and works under supervision of the Chief Market Strategist for Indosuez Wealth Management (IWM). They oversee the data-warehouse rules and processes for the categorization of financial instruments (Bonds, Equities, Funds) within the Securities Master File (SMF) used by Indosuez Wealth Management Solutions (WMS), as well as the exposures tool within Private Banking.

Your position

Sustainable Finance Related Categories

As part of the Sustainable finance governance of IWM and in close cooperation with the Responsible Investment Competence Centre (RICC) and the DPAM Quant Team, he or she will oversee the process for the Sustainable finance related categories that are relevant for WMS. He or she will also oversee new projects, in particular the design the Funds Data Hub, the next generation fund transparency tool, that is being developed in close cooperation with IWM Third-Party Funds team.

BE specific: MiFID related categories:

Being part of the ISG and as analysts who understand the nature of financial instruments, he or she oversees the rules governing the input at creation of certain MiFID related categories in the dedicated individual fields of the bank’s Securities Master File (SMF).

IWM Exposures Tool

He or she oversees the tool detailing the exposure of Private Banking to Financial Instruments Exposure (Equities, Bonds, Funds). The tool details exposure by Country, type of Mandate, number of clients… The tool regroups financial instruments to show exposure by issuer, credit rating, region, sector…

Key Member Of The Investment Strategy Group (ISG)


As part of his activities, the Junior Investment Data Analyst:
Implements data quality rules under the supervision of the Chief Data Office (CDO)
Participates to Sustainable Finance related workgroups and
Together with Chief Sustainability Officer, Chief Market Strategist and relevant compliance officers, further develop WMS Exclusion, ESG and Impact methodologies
Together with the relevant project teams, participates to the continuous optimization of workflows
Follows-up on questions from the second line (Compliance Monitoring Process or CMP) or the third line (Audit)


Your profile


Bachelor or master’s in Business Management, Finance or any related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to assimilate a large amount of information
A critical and synthetic mind, demonstrated proactive mindset
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Dutch and/or French
Team player and the ability to communicate easily
Flexible and autonomous in the way of working
Knowledge or first experience working with visualization tools, ideally PowerBI or SQL, Python being a great asset


Our offer

For more than 150 years, Degroof Petercam has been a reference investment house. Entrepreneurship is our DNA, expertise is our fuel. You will become part of a company with highly skilled, talented and passionate experts that aim for nothing less than excellence. The impact of our work goes beyond profit by looking at business from a broader perspective, challenging those who want to intellectually. As a part of Indosuez Wealth Management and Crédit Agricole, we offer our people ongoing learning and development and mobility on an international scale.

In addition to our fascinating work environment, we also offer:


A broad offer of learning & development programs including a Degroof Petercam Academy for both professional and personal goals.
An attractive and market conform compensation package
Flexible working hours & teleworking
An Employee Social Engagement Program
Access to the same Private Banking Expertise as our clients
Show more
