Title: Data Analist
Description:
Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en écht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.




Wat ga je doen?

Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologieën en methodes binnen de datawereld




Wie zoeken we?

Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid




Wat mag je verwachten?

Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen




Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

Show more

Title: BI Analyst – Remote-First
Description:
🚀 Be part of a movement to change the way Europe pays

In today’s digital world, payments often still feel outdated: random delays and confusing rules make it harder than it should be to pay and get paid. The European Payments Initiative (EPI) is here to change all that, forever.

With Wero, our digital wallet, we make sending and receiving money simple, seamless and secure across France, Belgium and Germany, with more countries and omnichannel solutions coming soon. Supported by 14 major banks and the two largest European acquirers, EPI is building a new, proudly European payment system: easy, instant and transparent, all for the greater good.


🔎 What's in it for you

Join us as our next Business Intelligence Analyst, bridging Finance and Data to convert raw figures into actionable insights, owning the SQL + Python pipelines in Azure and Databricks that fuel our financial dashboards, billing engines, and senior management insights. You will work closely with finance analysts, business stakeholders, and other technical teams to deliver data-driven insights and make data-informed decisions.


🐝 About the team

You’ll join a team of 3 talented Data Analytics experts based in the Netherlands, within the Finance department. Each team member brings unique skills and perspectives, fostering a rich learning environment.


💻 Technology stack

SQL, Power BI, Azure Cloud, Python, Databricks


💥 Your impact

Build & enhance financial reporting: Design new dashboards, reports, and self-service datasets for P&L, cash-flow, and margin analysis
Maintain operational calculations: Own monthly billing, revenue-recognition, and commission-calculation pipelines. Implement automated data-quality checks and reconciliation controls
Data modeling & pipeline engineering: • Develop medallion-architecture tables in Databricks (bronze/silver/gold)
Stakeholder collaboration: Translate finance requirements into technical specs. Train finance analysts on new datasets and BI tools
Continuous improvement & governance: Champion cost-optimization and FinOps best practices in Cloud platforms
Work across several legal entities: harmonization of data models and reporting standards to present a single source of truth


🕵🏻‍♀️ To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements

+3 years of hands-on experience writing advanced SQL, including window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and performance tuning
Proficiency in Python for data wrangling and automation
Practical experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex financial concepts into clear technical requirements
A proactive mindset with a strong bias for automation and thorough documentation
Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau

Nice to have:

Familiarity with dbt (data build tool)
Exposure to machine learning techniques for forecasting or anomaly detection
Understanding of financial analytics and reporting


🪜 If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:

A first call with one of our recruiters
Possibly, a business case or a tech assessment
A technical interview with the hiring manager
A final interview with the Chief of Finance
Hopefully, an offer you can’t refuse


⛔ Turn back if …


You don't have advanced experience with SQL and visualization tools
You cannot translate able to navigate from business to technical challenges




Otherwise apply!




🫶 Our commitment to equal employment opportunities


EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

Show more

  • Work across several legal entities: harmonization of data models and reporting standards to present a single source of truth


🕵🏻‍♀️ To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements

  • +3 years of hands-on experience writing advanced SQL, including window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and performance tuning
  • Proficiency in Python for data wrangling and automation
  • Practical experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex financial concepts into clear technical requirements
  • A proactive mindset with a strong bias for automation and thorough documentation
  • Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau

Nice to have:

  • Familiarity with dbt (data build tool)
  • Exposure to machine learning techniques for forecasting or anomaly detection
  • Understanding of financial analytics and reporting


🪜 If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:

  1. A first call with one of our recruiters
  2. Possibly, a business case or a tech assessment
  3. A technical interview with the hiring manager
  4. A final interview with the Chief of Finance
  5. Hopefully, an offer you can’t refuse


⛔ Turn back if …

  • You don't have advanced experience with SQL and visualization tools
  • You cannot translate able to navigate from business to technical challenges


Otherwise apply!


🫶 Our commitment to equal employment opportunities

EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Amaris Consulting is looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels

📝 Your Responsibilities:



Analyze and interpret large datasets to support business decisions.
Create dashboards and reports to communicate insights.
Collaborate with technical and business teams.
Ensure data quality and reliability.



👤 Your Profile:



Bachelor’s or Master’s in a relevant field.
Experience as a Data Analyst.
Skilled in SQL, Python or R, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Fluent in Dutch and English (French is a plus).
Dutch proficiency is mandatory. You must be bilingual (Dutch/English) or trilingual (Dutch, English, French).



🚀 Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



💡 We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Functional Data Analyst Consultant




Permanent contract




FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You’ll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.







Check out some of our ongoing projects:

Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.

If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if they match your profile!







Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:

Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Turning Data Management into practice.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.







Who you are:

Your interest & soft skills

A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Autonomous and solutions oriented.
Dynamic team player.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English.




Your technical experience

At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.
Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Proficient reporting and documentation skills.
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.










Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities.
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification.
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid ways of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels.
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances…
Read more about the benefits we offer here.




Apply now

We can't wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a team driving the energy transition and help build a sustainable, reliable, and green electricity system. Working alongside experts in market modelling and system adequacy, you’ll contribute to key studies that shape the future of the energy grid and support Europe’s security of supply goals.




What you will do:

You’ll be part of the Market Analysis team, contributing to a broader, forward-looking study required under European regulation to assess non-fossil flexibility needs for the next 5–10 years. Your tasks will include:

RES Integration Assessment: analyze curtailment and residual load statistics using economic dispatch results.
Ramping Needs Assessment: evaluate hourly ramping requirements and assess whether technologies can meet them.
Short-Term Flexibility Assessment: study system needs to cover unexpected demand/generation variations or outages.
Data Preparation & Reporting: ensure consistency across adequacy studies, outlooks, and flexibility indicators.
Methodology Development: implement regulatory requirements into concrete, quantified indicators.
Tooling & Automation: improve scripts and workflows in R/Python/Excel/VBA to process large datasets (10GB+).
Visualization & Communication: prepare clear visuals and statistics to present results to stakeholders.




What are we looking for?

You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a relevant role.
Strong skills in R or Python (must have; both is a plus).
Experience with data handling, statistical analysis, and scripting.
Good command of Excel (must have); VBA is a plus.
Knowledge of economic dispatch tools such as ANTARES is an advantage.
Experience with electricity market modelling or flexibility studies is a plus.
Knowledge of and genuine interest in the energy market.
Analytical mindset with problem-solving and innovative thinking.
Able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Passion for the energy transition and delivering high-quality tools.
Fluent in French or Dutch, plus fluent in English.




What do we offer?

Location: Hybrid

Contract: Freelance // 4 months

Start: September 1st 2025

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - no Experience Required
Description:
For thousands of years, MAPS have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a MAPS Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

Your responsabilities


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct.
You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately, resulting in better user experiences.
With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office.
The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge, a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Job requirements


Must be living in Belgium for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, MAP applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.


Ideal candidate:


Fluent in English and Dutch
Excellent research skills
Excellent local knowledge of your home country
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Belgium
Analytical mindset


Benefits


Work up to 20 hours per week
Earn a competitive rate of pay
Develop your research skills
Avoid the long commute
Work from the comfort of your home office
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours


Apply online today!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Robert Half is momenteel op zoek naar een Data Analyst (m/v/x) voor een bedrijf actief in de pharma sector. Onze klant is gelegen in Mechelen.


De verantwoordelijkheden voor deze functie zijn:

  • Je verzamelt en analyseert relevante markt- en cijferinformatie om strategische beslissingen en business cases te ondersteunen;
  • Je werkt grondige business cases uit, inclusief scenarioanalyses en levensvatbaarheidscriteria;
  • Je ondersteunt het beheer en de optimalisatie van het CRM-systeem en online bestelsystemen in samenwerking met interne en externe stakeholders;
  • Je beheert product- en klantendatabanken, inclusief prijzen en kortingen, vanuit het CRM-systeem en andere bestelsystemen;
  • Je ontwikkelt standaard- en ad-hoc rapporten om interne behoeften te vervullen en stakeholders te ondersteunen;
  • Je verhoogt de efficiëntie door rapporten en dashboards te standaardiseren en te optimaliseren;
  • Je presenteert analytische bevindingen en aanbevelingen aan het leiderschapsteam voor strategische besluitvorming;
  • Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de BI/BD Director.


Wat breng je mee?

  • Je hebt een achtergrond in bedrijfseconomie, ondersteund door een diploma;
  • Je beschikt over 2 tot 3 jaar relevante werkervaring;
  • Je hebt bewezen ervaring in het opstellen van business cases;
  • Je beheerst het Nederlands, Frans en Engels vlot;
  • Je bent zeer vaardig met MS Office, met name Excel (Pivot, DAX) en Power BI;
  • Je bent analytisch, probleemoplossend, en beschikt over commercieel inzicht;
  • Je denkt autonoom, werkt nauwkeurig en kan goed samenwerken met verschillende teams;
  • Je bent enthousiast en gedreven, en weet bruggen te bouwen tussen collega's.


Aanbod:

  • Een boeiende functie bij een bedrijf dat kiest voor een mensgerichte aanpak binnen de gezondheidszorg;
  • De kans om bij te dragen aan innovatieve oplossingen die welzijn en comfort verbeteren;
  • Een omgeving waar je collega's en klanten centraal staan, en iedere medewerker gewaardeerd wordt;
  • Een stimulerende bedrijfscultuur met een sterke focus op groei, samenwerking en het doorbreken van traditionele processen;
  • Competitieve arbeidsvoorwaarden en volop ruimte voor professionele ontwikkeling.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤖 The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.




✅ Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources.
Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.




🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.




Job requirements




🔎 The profile

You have at least 2 years experience.
You have worked on a data visualisation project in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.




💪 The Skills

You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have experience in working with Power BI in a professional setting.
You have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R and cloud platforms AWS, GCP and Azure.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You possess both strong technical abilities and soft skills to align technical- and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak fluent English and either Dutch or French.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...
Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Ready for a new chapter as a Data Analyst at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! 🎉

Show more

  • Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
  • Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.


🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.


Job requirements


🔎 The profile

  • You have at least 2 years experience.
  • You have worked on a data visualisation project in a professional setting.
  • You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
  • You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
  • You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.


💪 The Skills

  • You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
  • You have experience in working with Power BI in a professional setting.
  • You have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R and cloud platforms AWS, GCP and Azure.
  • You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
  • You possess both strong technical abilities and soft skills to align technical- and business stakeholders and drive change.
  • You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
  • You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
  • You speak fluent English and either Dutch or French.


💰 The Offer

  • An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
  • Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
  • Hospitalization and group insurance
  • High-end laptop
  • Smartphone with subscription
  • Substantial amount of holidays
  • Meal vouchers
  • ...
  • Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
  • A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
  • Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.


📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.


🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Ready for a new chapter as a Data Analyst at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! 🎉

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Data Strategist

About Remobi:

We are Remobi – we empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-performing, REMOTE nearshore technology teams.

Join our community to access meaningful freelance projects and help shape how companies operate.




Position Overview:

Location: Fully Remote

Role Type: Freelance/B2B/Contract

Duration: Long term engagement




Position Summary:

We're seeking a Data Strategist to drive rollout governance, interface management, and organizational standardization across departments and brands. You’ll support strategic planning, coordinate cross-functional programs, and turn departmental needs into actionable IT roadmaps.




Responsibilities:

Define/manage cross-functional interfaces and rollout processes
Coordinate rollout strategy, tracking, and governance
Align IT and business goals; consolidate departmental needs
Lead workshops, project meetings, and stakeholder collaboration
Support strategic planning, resource allocation, and roadmap development




Qualifications:

Experience in data strategy, rollout management, or enterprise IT consulting
Strong understanding of interface dependencies, governance, and change processes
Excellent stakeholder coordination and communication skills
Proven ability to translate business needs into IT plans




If this sounds like a match or you know someone suitable, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: AI/DATA Business Analyst
Description:
Don’t settle for just any consulting company, choose the one that’s right for you!




We’re on the lookout for a AI/DATA Business Analyst to join our expanding AI & Data start-up.




As Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.




You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.

However, this isn’t the job for you if you’re looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. 🚀

As a AI/DATA Business Analyst, you’ll be at the crossroads between business and technology. Your mission will be to:

Dive deep into business needs and turn them into clear, actionable requirements.
Take full ownership of projects, making sure stakeholders stay aligned and delivery stays on track.
Work hand-in-hand with our technical teams to shape solution architectures and create documentation that helps development move smoothly.

You’re a step closer to joining our team if you bring:

Background:

A bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field (business, engineering, or similar).
2–4 years of experience in a business analyst or project manager role.
Hands-on experience in a data or AI project (a big plus for us).

Technical Skills:

A solid understanding of project management approaches, especially Agile and Scrum.

Soft Skills:

Strong communication skills, comfortable talking with both business and tech stakeholders.
The ability to translate business needs into technical requirements, and vice versa.
A structured approach to project management and delivery.

Practical Info:

Languages: Fluent English, plus native proficiency in either French or Dutch.

We know that finding the right job isn’t just about the role, it’s about what’s in it for you, too. While we’re a start-up, we’re big on taking care of our people right from day one.

Here’s a sneak peek at what we offer:

💰 A compensation package that keeps you motivated:

Competitive salary
Mobility budget or company car with a fuel card
30 days of paid time off
A top-tier laptop & smartphone with a subscription
Representation allowances
Hospitalization & dental insurance
Meal vouchers
Opportunity to earn company stock over time

🎯 A place to be your best self, grow, and thrive:

Work with the most innovative technologies in Data & AI
Work in an agile, collaborative environment
Hybrid work model
Monthly team-building events (plus one epic annual celebration)
Tailored training programs to fuel your career growth
A cool, ergonomic office with creative meeting spaces
A Nintendo Switch for spontaneous Mario Kart battles 🎮
A massage chair for those deep-thinking moments 🧘
Fresh coffee & drinks to keep you energized ☕

✨ And most importantly, a fast-growing company where opportunities are limitless!

Our Recruitment Process:

Quick intro call with our HR team (5min)
HR Interview (30min)
Partner Interview (1h)
Interview with client (1h)

How to apply?

You can apply right here on LinkedIn.




If you’re passionate about what we do but aren’t sure you meet every single requirement—don’t hesitate to apply. We value potential, mindset, and growth as much as experience. At Data Wizards, we believe diversity is our strength. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and experiences because different viewpoints help us grow and evolve.




Let’s build the future of AI & Data, together 🤝




Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we’ll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions, and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

Let’s build the future of AI & Data, together 🤝


Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we’ll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions, and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

Title: Reward Data Analyst
Description:
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Our Reward Team helps clients navigate the
total reward landscape in a tailor-made and result-oriented way. From
developing rewards strategy to implementing innovative solutions such as the EU
Pay Transparency Directive. They bring together the right mix of expertise—covering
everything from reward, tax & legal, employee communication, to tech and
process.

Role Summary: 

As a Rewards Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in
supporting our clients' rewards and compensation & benefits strategies. You
will leverage your analytical skills and statistical expertise to
provide insights and solutions that drive pay transparency and equity. This
position offers an exciting opportunity to work with a multidisciplinary team
and contribute to impactful projects that shape the future of reward systems.

Key Responsibilities:

Conduct comprehensive reward & compensation
analyses using statistical methods and regression models.
Pivotal member of our pay equity & transparency
team (see more information: Pay
Transparency and Pay Equity)
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to
implement pay equity & transparency initiatives.
Utilise R and Python for data analysis and
visualisation to support reward strategies.
Assist in the development of tailored reward
programs that align with organisational goals.
Prepare detailed reports and presentations to
communicate findings and recommendations.
Support the implementation of innovative
solutions such as the EU Pay Transparency Directive.

Let’s Talk About You!

At least 1 – 3 years (junior profile) or 4 - 6 years (senior profile) of experience in data analytics.

Experience in applying statistical techniques

Experience working with R, Python and Power BI.

Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably one additional language (Dutch or French).

Strong analytical skills with proficiency in compensation analysis, market benchmarking tools, benefits management systems, Excel, PowerPoint, HRIS, and data visualisation tools.

Demonstrated ability to think strategically, innovate, provide high-impact solutions, and effectively manage projects to successful completion.


Global Employer Services (GES) team is fully aware today’s digital revolution is rapidly rewriting the environment for employers and their global workforces. The need for mobility is greater than ever. We help our clients achieve control, gain perspective, and lead with confidence through this period of uncertainty and technological change. Our professionals focus on providing personal tax, compensation & benefits and international assignment/HR services to our clients. We assist our clients to streamline their HR, Mobility and Rewards programs, while managing tax effectiveness, compliance and employment costs, both in a global and domestic context.
Reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll advisory designed just for you! Our professionals help you design cost-effective, tax-efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs.
Our story - Global Employer Services (GES)
In today's digital revolution, the environment for employers and their (global) workforces is rapidly evolving, with an increased need for adaptability. The GES team is dedicated to helping clients navigate these challenges with confidence, providing expertise in rewards, compensation & benefits, personal tax and international assignment/HR services.
Our focus is on streamlining HR, Rewards and Mobility programs to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and cost management in both global and domestic contexts. We offer specialised advisory services in reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.
Our professionals are committed to designing cost-effective, efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs. We are here to support your journey towards pay transparency and equity, ensuring your compensation strategies are both attractive to employees and beneficial for your business.

Why work in GES?

Passion: Driven by a love for mobility, payroll, and rewards services, crafting both local and global solutions in a sustainable way.

People-focused: Working with and for people. Investing in coaching, learning, and developing the team, making sure everyone grows.

Professionalism: Delivering excellence as a united team, ensuring success for their clients and for each other.


Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:


My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities

Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte

Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte

Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte

Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities


Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality

Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).

Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst Senior (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !


Show more

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Quality Analyst, you’ll support our clients with their data quality needs:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
You know all about the SQL.
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




ABOUT US




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our recruiters and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? 🚀🌍

At TEKEVER, we lead innovation in Europe as the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation.

💻 Digital | 🛡️ Defence | 🔒 Security | 🛰️ Space

We operate across four strategic areas, combining artificial intelligence, systems engineering, data science, and aerospace technology to tackle global challenges — from protecting people and critical infrastructure to exploring space.

We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that delivers real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. Our products and services support strategic and operational decisions in the most demanding environments — whether at sea, on land, in space, or in cyberspace.

🌐 Become part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary, and mission-driven team that is transforming maritime surveillance and redefining global safety standards.

At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to empower critical decision-making.

If you're passionate about technology and eager to shape the future — TEKEVER is the place for you. 👇🏻🎯

Job Overview

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to the development, implementation, and optimization of advanced algorithms and models and data understanding. Your work will support key teams such as Field Operations, R&D, Flights, Simulation, Autopilot by automating workflows and enhancing decision support, mission planning, and situational awareness capabilities.

What Will Be Your Responsibilities


Conduct in-depth analysis to identify patterns, anomalies, and insights across multi-modal datasets.
Present analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences, including stakeholders and leadership.
Translate business challenges into analytical solutions and data strategies.
Build and fit statistical and machine learning models; evaluate and refine them for performance.
Develop interactive dashboards for situational awareness using tools like Power BI and Grafana.
Collaborate with data engineers to optimize pipelines and ensure scalable, real-time data workflows.
Perform ad-hoc analysis for strategic decision support.
Ensure high standards of data integrity and accuracy.
Create intelligible reports with actionable conclusions and clear visualizations.
Integrate and analyse data from diverse sources including drone sensors, GIS, and real-time systems.
Partner with data scientists to monitor and enhance the performance of deployed models.


Profile And Requirements


Education
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fields.
A Ph.D. is a plus.
Experience
3+ years in data science or machine learning, especially with time series or predictive modeling.
Strong experience handling sensor data, GIS, unstructured text, and other multi-modal data types.
Familiarity with mission-critical domains such as field ops, aviation, or defense is highly valued.
Proven ability to build, deploy, and monitor machine learning models in production.
Experience working on real-time dashboards and decision systems.
Technical Skills
Programming & Software Engineering
Advanced proficiency in Python for data scripting, analysis, and automation.
Strong grasp of software engineering practices, including version control (Git) and DevOps basics.
Data Frameworks & Libraries
Hands-on experience with Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn for data manipulation and modeling.
Familiarity with ETL processes, database design, and vector database applications.
Data Storage & Querying
Strong command of SQL for complex data retrieval and optimization.
Experience working with DBMS, data warehousing, and cloud data storage (especially GCP).
Modeling & Statistical Analysis
Solid foundation in statistics: regression, hypothesis testing, distribution analysis.
Skilled in model fitting, feature engineering, and performance evaluation.
Data Visualization & Dashboarding
Expert in Power BI, Grafana, Looker, Streamlit, Gradio for reporting and dashboards.
Experience with Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly for advanced visual storytelling.
Strong data communication and storytelling capabilities.
Geospatial & Sensor Analytics
Experience with GIS systems, drone sensors, and tools such as GeoPandas, Rasterio, QGIS.
Ability to extract and interpret spatial and time-series insights.
Cloud & Deployment
Familiar with Google Cloud Platform and deployment of analytics/data tools on cloud infrastructure.
Other Requirements
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a sharp eye for operational and strategic insight.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively in a high-paced, multidisciplinary environment.
Awareness of AI ethics, fairness, and bias mitigation best practices.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills for cross-functional collaboration.

What We Have To Offer You


An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world;
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics;
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems;
Flexible work arrangements;
Professional development opportunities;
Collaborative and inclusive work environment;
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.


TEKEVER is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Do you want to know more about us ?

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

TEKEVER is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

Title: Data analyst PowerBI & SAP BO (Freelance)
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Power BI Expert for our client in the financial sector. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in Power BI, and the ability to translate complex data into meaningful insights.

The consultant will work as a Power BI Expert within the Cash development team (6 people).

The overall project involves:


Migrating the data from the CashSSP datawarehouse to the cloud.
Converting a large number of static PDF reports (SAP BO) into Power BI reports that meet the same business requirements.



This new data warehouse will be leveraged by 12 European countries, making it a crucial tool for strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.

Key Responsabilities

1. Coaching & Mentoring (50%)

You will dedicate approximately half of your time coaching and mentoring a team composed of IT developers and less experienced business users. Your role will be to guide them in improving their skills, adopting best practices, and deepening their understanding of Power BI data modeling and data visualization.

2. Data Modeling & Report Development (50%)

The remaining portion of your role will focus on:


Designing, implementing, and maintaining robust semantic models to support scalable, performant, consistent reporting including support for self-service analytics by business users.
Developing and optimizing Power BI reports and dashboards that deliver clear insights aligned with business requirements. Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure the alignment of technical solutions with business objectives.



Required Skills & Qualifications

1. Coaching & BI Expertise


Proven experience as a Power BI Expert in a complex, enterprise environment.
Power BI certification is a strong asset.
Expertise in DAX, Power Query, and Power BI Desktop/Service.
Experience in creating paginated reports is a plus.
Strong communication and mentoring skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Team-oriented mindset and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with Azure or other cloud platforms is preferred.
Knowledge of SAP BO to analyze existing reports is considered as a significant advantage



2. Semantic Modeling


Solid experience in data modeling, data transformation, and data integration.
Ability to design semantic layers that ensure data consistency and performance.
Knowledge of Row-Level Security (RLS) implementation in a multi-country, multi-user environment.
Understanding of different data connectivity modes (Import, DirectQuery, Live Connection) and when to use them.
Experience with Power BI deployment pipelines, workspace structuring, and lifecycle management.



3. Report Development


Strong understanding of data visualization best practices, including layout, user experience, and accessibility.
Ability to translate business requirements into impactful dashboards and visuals.
(Optional) Experience working directly with business stakeholders to gather and refine reporting needs.

Title: Aviation Energy Data Analyst
Description:
IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN THIS ROLE, PLEASE APPLY VIA OUR WEBSITE FOLLOWING THIS LINK : https://jobs.transportenvironment.org/o/aviation-energy-data-analyst




Your application won't be taking into consideration if you only apply via LinkedIn, thanks.










🫵Role: Aviation Energy Data Analyst

📍 Location: Brussels

📅 Application Deadline: 05/09/2025

✒️ Start Date: ASAP







Are you concerned by transport’s climate impact and continued reliance on fossil fuels? Have you got experience in how the electricity system will need to adapt to cope with the changes to both supply and additional demand? T&E is looking for a talented and dynamic data analyst to join the team to work on electro-sustainable aviation fuels (e-SAF). The electrification of transport and acceleration of the deployment of renewable energy will create both challenges and opportunities in the green transition. The analyst will work alongside the shipping and energy team to build a case for e-fuels to use in transport’s hard-to-abate sectors.




Aviation is a challenging sector to decarbonize. We’re looking for a data analyst to research available aviation decarbonization options, using data and research to inform policy and financial instruments in order to deliver the required fuels. We need convincing and compelling charts, analysis, reports and presentations to convert complex information into advocacy and media friendly material. Finally, we need to convince European lawmakers to set ambitious but achievable goals to drive the sector from being the fastest growing climate problem to one of sustainability.




This position requires an engineer or scientist with experience in environmental science, energy systems or related fields.







Main functions of the role:




● Taking a leading role on T&E’s analytical work on green energy for aviation

● Compiling robust and compelling data, evidence and argumentation in order to reduce aviation’s climate impact.

● Developing analytical models and tools, conducting market analysis, and quantifying the impact of regulations to inform policy solutions and T&E strategy

● Analyzing data as well as complex policy issues from a variety of sources including scientific studies, European Commission reports and models being used to shape EU policy

● Support the organization with ad hoc requests and fast technical responses for both internal and for third party stakeholders, such as policy makers and journalists.

● Advocating T&E’s position to policymakers at EU and national level, politicians, business leaders, civil society actors and our international network.

● Converting large data sets or complex policy implications into clear, robust and beautiful charts.










The successful candidate would ideally meet the following criteria:




● At least two years relevant experience in the field of energy and/or transport. This position is open to talented entry level candidates to those with 5+ years experience. Job title and salary will reflect previous experience.

Expertise in and knowledge of energy systems, electricity markets and synthetic fuels and their processes.

● Have strong analytical skills, an ability to quickly grasp technical issues, assess data, and good knowledge of Excel. Python programming would be an advantage.

● Relevant professional experience working on technical issues in the environmental or energy sectors, or in a research institution

● Project management experience including strong interpersonal and team-working skills and an ability to deliver to tight deadlines.

● Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to write in English fluently, accurately and concisely. Other European languages are considered a bonus

● The confidence to think and act with initiative, to engage and influence policymakers of different stripes, industry representatives and other stakeholders at the highest level.







Practicalities




This position is advertised as a permanent, full-time position based in Brussels. While we offer a flexible working environment, there is an expectation that there are at least two days per week spent in the office. Candidates can also be based in cities in our nearby national offices: Paris, London, or Berlin. For candidates based in those cities, there is an expectation that they will work in the T&E offices at least two days a week, and will spend several days per month in Brussels.




The salary package depends on location and experience. We are an equal opportunities employer and offer competitive salary and benefits.

We’re looking for a data analyst to research available aviation decarbonization options, using data and research to inform policy and financial instruments in order to deliver the required fuels. We need convincing and compelling charts, analysis, reports and presentations to convert complex information into advocacy and media friendly material. Finally, we need to convince European lawmakers to set ambitious but achievable goals to drive the sector from being the fastest growing climate problem to one of sustainability.


This position requires an engineer or scientist with experience in environmental science, energy systems or related fields.



Main functions of the role:


● Taking a leading role on T&E’s analytical work on green energy for aviation

● Compiling robust and compelling data, evidence and argumentation in order to reduce aviation’s climate impact.

● Developing analytical models and tools, conducting market analysis, and quantifying the impact of regulations to inform policy solutions and T&E strategy

● Analyzing data as well as complex policy issues from a variety of sources including scientific studies, European Commission reports and models being used to shape EU policy

● Support the organization with ad hoc requests and fast technical responses for both internal and for third party stakeholders, such as policy makers and journalists.

● Advocating T&E’s position to policymakers at EU and national level, politicians, business leaders, civil society actors and our international network.

● Converting large data sets or complex policy implications into clear, robust and beautiful charts.




The successful candidate would ideally meet the following criteria:


● At least two years relevant experience in the field of energy and/or transport. This position is open to talented entry level candidates to those with 5+ years experience. Job title and salary will reflect previous experience.

Expertise in and knowledge of energy systems, electricity markets and synthetic fuels and their processes.

● Have strong analytical skills, an ability to quickly grasp technical issues, assess data, and good knowledge of Excel. Python programming would be an advantage.

● Relevant professional experience working on technical issues in the environmental or energy sectors, or in a research institution

● Project management experience including strong interpersonal and team-working skills and an ability to deliver to tight deadlines.

● Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to write in English fluently, accurately and concisely. Other European languages are considered a bonus

● The confidence to think and act with initiative, to engage and influence policymakers of different stripes, industry representatives and other stakeholders at the highest level.



Practicalities


This position is advertised as a permanent, full-time position based in Brussels. While we offer a flexible working environment, there is an expectation that there are at least two days per week spent in the office. Candidates can also be based in cities in our nearby national offices: Paris, London, or Berlin. For candidates based in those cities, there is an expectation that they will work in the T&E offices at least two days a week, and will spend several days per month in Brussels.


The salary package depends on location and experience. We are an equal opportunities employer and offer competitive salary and benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?

With us, your expertise won’t just sit in dashboards – it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we’re looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You’ll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact – all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will:


translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems…)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios


What You Bring To The Table


5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English


Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Want to tackle tomorrow’s multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today’s three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:


a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)


Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?

We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers – 02 370 30 62 – erwin.verniers@external.equans.com – https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers
