Title: Business insights analyst Intern
Description:
About Us:

CHANEL is a dynamic and innovative player in the travel retail industry, committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our global customers. As part of our continued growth, we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Insights Analyst Intern to join our Global Travel Retail Team. This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our business through insightful data analysis and reporting.

Position Overview:

As a Business Insights Analyst Intern with the Global Travel Retail Team at CHANEL, you will have a versatile role that contributes to both analytical tasks and the strategic communication of findings. You will be responsible for synthesizing business intelligence data, producing monthly reports, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making. You will play an important role in enhancing our existing data models, ensuring accuracy, and presenting information in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate is proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, possesses strong analytical skills, and is a collaborative team player.

Key Responsibilities:



Data Management and Relationship Building:
Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
Data Analysis and Recommendations:
Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
Industry Insight and Trend Analysis:
Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
Reporting Excellence :
Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyse data on the travel retail industry.
Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
Dashboard Maintenance:
Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
Support and Collaboration:
Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects & Insights Director in daily operations.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.



Job Conditions:

An internship agreement is mandatory for this position and must meet the following conditions:



The internship must be part of your study program.
The internship must be required for the completion of your degree.
The internship must be validated by the award of academic credits.



Job Information:



Contract: Full-time internship (100%) and in-person
Start date: January 5, 2026
Duration: 6 months
Working days: 5 days a week, Monday to Friday
Location: Geneva



Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

  • Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
  • Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
  • Data Analysis and Recommendations:
  • Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
  • Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
  • Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
  • Industry Insight and Trend Analysis:
  • Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
  • Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
  • Reporting Excellence :
  • Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyse data on the travel retail industry.
  • Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
  • Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
  • Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
  • Dashboard Maintenance:
  • Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
  • Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
  • Support and Collaboration:
  • Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects & Insights Director in daily operations.
  • Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
  • Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
  • Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
  • Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
  • Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
  • Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  • Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
  • Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
  • Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.


Job Conditions:

An internship agreement is mandatory for this position and must meet the following conditions:


  • The internship must be part of your study program.
  • The internship must be required for the completion of your degree.
  • The internship must be validated by the award of academic credits.


Job Information:


  • Contract: Full-time internship (100%) and in-person
  • Start date: January 5, 2026
  • Duration: 6 months
  • Working days: 5 days a week, Monday to Friday
  • Location: Geneva


Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

Title: Graduate BI Specialist
Description:
Our client is a top-tier organisation that combines the agility and innovation of a startup with the stability and professionalism of an established company. They are committed to empowering their teams with cutting-edge data capabilities, ensuring insights are accessible, secure, and actionable across the business.




The Role

We are looking for a Looker Administrator & Enablement Specialist to drive the adoption of self-service analytics, train users, and manage system access. You’ll play a key role in enabling teams to get the most out of Looker while ensuring security and scalability.




Key Responsibilities

Act as the primary Looker administrator, managing permissions, authorisations, and governance.
Design and deliver engaging training sessions and resources to upskill business users.
Drive self-service adoption and act as an internal champion for data literacy.
Collaborate with stakeholders to manage change and ensure smooth adoption of new processes and features.
Partner with technical teams to continuously improve the Looker environment.




About You

Proven experience as a Looker admin (or similar BI platform).
Strong knowledge of access management, permissions, and governance.
Skilled in training design and delivery for non-technical audiences.
Experience with change management and driving user adoption.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.




Why Join?

Be part of a forward-thinking organisation at the intersection of innovation and stability.
Play a pivotal role in shaping how the company uses data.
Remote first (fortnightly office visits but work from where you want!)
Enjoy a collaborative environment where your expertise directly impacts business outcomes.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (CDI - 100%)
Description:
QoQa c'est tout d'abord près d'1 million de membres de notre magnifique Qommunauté qui profitent chaque jour de bons plans dénichés par nos équipes.

Notre succès, nous le devons avant tout au formidable travail de nos 240 loutres qui oeuvrent quotidiennement pour proposer le meilleur service possible.

Nous recherchons désormais la perle rare pour rejoindre la team Data!

Ta mission, si tu l'acceptes


Tu rejoindras l'équipe Data afin de soutenir les départements Finances et Ressources Humaines dans la mise en place d'un environnement de données robuste, sécurisé et orienté analyse.
Ton objectif : garantir la clarté et la fiabilité des indicateurs internes pour permettre un pilotage éclairé et proactif de notre organisation.
En étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers, tu sauras comprendre leurs enjeux pour concevoir des solutions pertinentes, adaptées et réellement data-driven.
Tu participeras également à différents projets transverses de l'équipe, selon les priorités du moment.


Parlons de toi et de tes compétences

Ton expérience - Ta formation


Bachelor en informatique, de gestion des données ou domaine équivalent.
Minimum 3 ans d'expérience en traitement et analyse de données dans un poste similaire.
Une expérience et des connaissances dans les domaines de la Finance, comptabilité et payroll constituent un atout majeur.


Tes compétences - Tes qualités


Excellente maîtrise de SQL et bonne compréhension des bases de données relationnelles.
Expérience confirmée avec DBT (Data Build Tool) ou un outil similaire pour la gestion de pipelines de données.
Connaissance de GitHub
Bonne maîtrise d'un outil de datavisualisation, idéalement Tableau, pour transformer les données en rapports clairs et percutants.
Capacité à collaborer avec les métiers, à comprendre leurs besoins et à concevoir des solutions pertinentes.
Approche rigoureuse et orientée résultats.
Intérêt marqué pour les logiques comptables, RH ou financières.
Connaissance de l'ERP Odoo (un plus).


Pour que tu restes au taQuet, on t'offre


Un environnement sain où tu peux être toi même
Un système de gouvernance en Holacratie
Une ambiance et cadre de travail agréables dans notre nouveau QG
Un temps de travail flexible, et hybride
Des avantages aux petits oignons (LPP avantageuse, plan de mobilité, abonnement téléphonique pris en charge, 5 semaines de vacances, 10 chf crédités chaque jour pour manger dans notre super restaurant du QG...)
La possibilité de formation continue et développement


Les prochaines étapes

Tu sens que tu peux relever ce défi ?

Pour entrer dans la course, il te suffit de nous envoyer au minimum un CV et une lettre de motivation personnalisée. Dis-nous pourquoi tu serais la personne parfaite pour ce job et quels sont tes super-pouvoirs : Surprends-nous!

Nous te remercions (et la planète aussi) de ne pas envoyer de candidature papier.

Si ton parcours correspond avec nos attentes pour le poste, nous t'inviterons à découvrir notre tanière et à nous faire découvrir tes talents sur le terrain. Dans le cas contraire, tu recevras un e-mail des loutres dans les meilleurs délais.

Alors maintenant, jette-toi à l'eau et tente ta chance!

Entrée en fonction : ASAP (mais on pourra t'attendre si tu es la bonne personne)

Durée du contrat : Indéterminée

Taux: 100%

Lieu : Bussigny, QG
Show more

Title: Associate / Senior Analyst – Reporting & Analytics
Description:
About the company

Phoenix Search has partnered with a renowned venture capital firm with a strong presence in technology-enabled industries such as e-commerce, fintech, mobility, gaming, and AI. With a global presence, they have a successful track record of 30 years in the industry. The firm is

committed to driving innovation and growth through strategic investments and exceptional portfolio management.




The opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Analyst/Associate to enhance the Reporting &

Analytics function within the Operations Team. This role is pivotal in

driving efficiencies and fostering data-driven decision-making across

the firm. The ideal candidate will have a passion for global financial

markets, an analytical mindset, and thrive in a dynamic environment.




If you are ready to contribute to a high-performing team and make an

impact through your analytical skills, this could be the perfect

opportunity for you.




Responsibilities

Analyse the architecture and relationships within investment and reporting systems.
Prepare quarterly reports, capital account statements, and fund dashboards.
Review financial statements and cash flows for consistency with deliverables.
Support portfolio company valuations through rigorous analysis.
Lead quantitative and qualitative analyses to derive insights.
Synthesise portfolio performance data to aid in year-end fund audits.
Identify and implement continuous improvements to enhance reporting efficiency.
Address ad-hoc requests from both internal and external stakeholders.




Requirements

Degree qualified (Bachelor’s or Master’s) in finance, economics, engineering, or business.
Strong Excel skills and solid understanding of financial accounting principles.
Familiarity with databases (SQL a plus); MacOS experience is beneficial.
Detail-oriented, motivated, and able to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with a critical eye for process improvement.
Show more

Title: Reporting analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Your mission is to empower our Field Sales Force by owning the calculation, allocation, and tracking of performance targets for our Business Developers (BDs) and Local Key Account Managers (LKAMs). With a strong analytical mindset and business understanding, you’ll play a key role in driving our Route-To-Market strategy (including the definition and tracking of KBIs), aligning execution with market needs and Group methodologies. Your work will directly contribute to revenue growth, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency – creating long-term, sustainable competitive advantage in the market.




Your new key responsibilities

Prepare and deliver regular, user-friendly reports and scorecards that provide clear visibility into sales force performance.
Develop and maintain dashboards and performance-tracking tools (Power BI, Excel) to monitor key KPIs across teams and territories.
Analyze market trends, sales performance data, and distribution efficiency to support business decisions and continuous improvement.
Calculate and allocate sales targets for BDs (Out Of Home & At Home) and LKAMs in line with business objectives and strategic plans.
Track progress against targets and support final bonus calculations.
Respond to ad-hoc requests from internal stakeholders (Marketing, Sales, Commercial Excellence, etc.) related to reporting, field sales processes, or analysis.
Collaborate in the development, testing, and tracking of new reporting tools and scorecards.
Participate in cross-functional processes and projects, ensuring consistency and efficiency across teams.
Actively contribute to the evolution and execution of the Route-To-Market Strategy, aligning local needs with Group best practices.




Are these your secret ingredients?

You have completed a higher education degree or equivalent practical experience.
You bring at least 3 years of relevant work experience, ideally in sales operations, business analytics, or performance management.
You are fluent in English and either German or French.
You have strong analytical skills and are confident working with large datasets.
You are proficient in MS Excel and Power BI.
You manage your time and priorities effectively, and you are comfortable working across multiple processes and stakeholders.
You communicate clearly, and you know how to translate data into insights that matter.
You understand sales and distribution processes, stakeholder needs, industry trends, and the importance of SLAs.
You have a structured, data-driven mindset and a proactive, collaborative approach.

Apply today and send us your complete application documents including your motivation letter and job references in a single PDF file. We do not consider applications coming in via e-mail.




At Coca-Cola HBC, we are an inclusive employer that thrives on diversity. This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.

Show more

Title: Graduate Analytics Consultant
Description:
We are looking for a BI Enablement Specialist who is passionate about helping others learn and grow in the use of modern business intelligence platforms. This role focuses on training and upskilling users in Looker, Power BI, and Honeydew AI, enabling them to build their own reports and analyses confidently while maintaining data quality and security.




This position is ideal for a recent graduate or early-career professional who is eager to dive deep into BI tools and become an expert in both the technical and enablement aspects. You’ll learn the platforms inside-out and play a key role in supporting our organisation’s BI adoption journey.




This is the chance to join a top-tier organisation that combines the agility and innovation of a startup with the stability and professionalism of an established company.




Main Responsibilities

Develop and deliver training programmes: Create learning materials, workshops, and online courses tailored to different user groups.
Upskill and support users: Run consultation sessions, maintain FAQs, and provide guidance to help users build confidence in self-service BI.
Promote BI adoption: Foster a community of practice, gather feedback, and share updates to keep users engaged and informed.
Ensure governance alignment: Learn and apply role/authorisation models to safeguard data access and compliance.
Track and improve adoption: Monitor usage, evaluate support requests, and suggest improvements to training and processes.




What You’ll Bring

Willingness to master BI tools (Looker, Power BI, Honeydew AI) and share knowledge with others.
Interest in training, teaching, or facilitation — ability to explain complex topics simply.
Strong communication and organisational skills.
Curiosity about data governance, access models, and cloud BI environments (previous knowledge is a plus, but not required).
Enthusiasm for building communities, supporting peers, and driving change adoption.




Preferred Background

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in business informatics, computer science, education, or related fields — but we welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds with a strong interest in BI.
Some exposure to BI, analytics, or data-related projects (e.g., coursework, internships, personal projects) is a plus.
Experience in training, mentoring, or knowledge-sharing is beneficial, but not mandatory.




Why Join

Opportunity to become an expert in Looker, Power BI, and Honeydew AI.
Gain hands-on experience in BI enablement, training design, and governance.
Work in a role that combines technology, communication, and impact, shaping how teams use data across the business.
Supportive environment for learning, growth, and professional development.

Show more

QoQa c’est tout d’abord près d'1 million de membres de notre magnifique Qommunauté qui profitent chaque jour de bons plans dénichés par nos équipes.

Notre succès, nous le devons avant tout au formidable travail de nos 240 loutres qui œuvrent quotidiennement pour proposer le meilleur service possible.

Nous recherchons désormais la perle rare pour rejoindre la team Data!


Ta mission, si tu l’acceptes


  • Tu rejoindras l’équipe Data afin de soutenir les départements Finances et Ressources Humaines dans la mise en place d’un environnement de données robuste, sécurisé et orienté analyse.
  • Ton objectif : garantir la clarté et la fiabilité des indicateurs internes pour permettre un pilotage éclairé et proactif de notre organisation.
  • En étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers, tu sauras comprendre leurs enjeux pour concevoir des solutions pertinentes, adaptées et réellement data-driven.
  • Tu participeras également à différents projets transverses de l’équipe, selon les priorités du moment.


Parlons de toi et de tes compétences


Ton expérience - Ta formation

  • Bachelor en informatique, de gestion des données ou domaine équivalent.
  • Minimum 3 ans d’expérience en traitement et analyse de données dans un poste similaire.
  • Une expérience et des connaissances dans les domaines de la Finance, comptabilité et payroll constituent un atout majeur.


Tes compétences - Tes qualités

  • Excellente maîtrise de SQL et bonne compréhension des bases de données relationnelles.
  • Expérience confirmée avec DBT (Data Build Tool) ou un outil similaire pour la gestion de pipelines de données.
  • Connaissance de GitHub
  • Bonne maîtrise d’un outil de datavisualisation, idéalement Tableau, pour transformer les données en rapports clairs et percutants.
  • Capacité à collaborer avec les métiers, à comprendre leurs besoins et à concevoir des solutions pertinentes.
  • Approche rigoureuse et orientée résultats.
  • Intérêt marqué pour les logiques comptables, RH ou financières.
  • Connaissance de l’ERP Odoo (un plus).


Pour que tu restes au taQuet, on t’offre

  • Un environnement sain où tu peux être toi même
  • Un système de gouvernance en Holacratie
  • Une ambiance et cadre de travail agréables dans notre nouveau QG
  • Un temps de travail flexible, et hybride
  • Des avantages aux petits oignons (LPP avantageuse, plan de mobilité, abonnement téléphonique pris en charge, 5 semaines de vacances, 10 chf crédités chaque jour pour manger dans notre super restaurant du QG…)
  • La possibilité de formation continue et développement

Les prochaines étapes


Tu sens que tu peux relever ce défi ?


Pour entrer dans la course, il te suffit de nous envoyer au minimum un CV et une lettre de motivation personnalisée. Dis-nous pourquoi tu serais la personne parfaite pour ce job et quels sont tes super-pouvoirs : Surprends-nous!


Nous te remercions (et la planète aussi) de ne pas envoyer de candidature papier.


Si ton parcours correspond avec nos attentes pour le poste, nous t’inviterons à découvrir notre tanière et à nous faire découvrir tes talents sur le terrain. Dans le cas contraire, tu recevras un e-mail des loutres dans les meilleurs délais.


Alors maintenant, jette-toi à l’eau et tente ta chance!


Entrée en fonction : ASAP (mais on pourra t’attendre si tu es la bonne personne)

Durée du contrat : Indéterminée

Taux: 100%

Lieu : Bussigny, QG

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Au sein de l'équipe spécialisée dans les ingrédients de parfumerie, vous serez le lien entre les équipes commerciales, réglementaires et opérationnelles, avec pour mission principale de gérer, mettre à jour et fiabiliser les données dans les systèmes.

Vos missions 

Mettre à jour les informations produits dans les systèmes internes (SAP, MDM, etc.)

Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données (packaging, localisations, spécifications…)

Lancer des audits de données et participer aux nettoyages

Analyser les données, produire des synthèses et formuler des recommandations

Vérifier les informations issues de sources réglementaires, fournisseurs ou bases clients

Accompagner les équipes commerciales dans la création des listes de prix et documents de négociation

Suivre les évolutions réglementaires, achats, production ou toxicologie impactant le business

Coordonner la communication entre les différentes équipes

Rédiger et transmettre les communications internes et externes liées aux produits ou aux changements

Votre profil 

Minimum 5 années d’expérience au sein d'un poste similaire, idéalement dans le secteur chimique à l'international

Excellente maîtrise de SAP et de Microsoft Excel

À l’aise avec les bases de données, les systèmes d'information et la communication inter-départements

Bilingue Anglais - Français

Excellente organisation, gestion du temps et rigueur

Aisance relationnelle et sens de la communication

Job Requirements Si vous correspondez au profil recherché et que vous souhaitez rejoindre une équipe dynamique, veuillez soumettre votre dossier complet. Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature !Company description Pour un de nos clients, spécialisé dans le secteur de la chimie, nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst pour une mission temporaire de 6 mois.
Show more

Title: BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
Description:
DonTouch SA is a digital company based in Switzerland that operates some of the largest marketplaces in Europe: Italy, Spain, Germany, and the UK.

With over 60,000 paying advertisers annually, our properties reach more than 7 million unique monthly active users, across the web and mobile apps for both iOS and Android.

For our HQ in Chiasso (CH) we are seeking a:

BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST

(NO REMOTE)

For this position we are looking for a professional accustomed to making technological decisions and managing requests from various departments based on business priorities and needs.

This role requires combining strong analytical skills with knowledge and experience in Business Intelligence solutions, with excellent written and verbal communication skills, to interact clearly and convincingly with cross-functional stakeholders.

The ideal profile is able to work closely with key stakeholders (mainly at C-level) to create systematic insights, data visualization, intuitive dashboards and data modeling to support analysis in decision-making processes.

An innovative and open-minded individual, able to work independently and with the experience to manage a team.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders (sales, marketing, IT) to develop tools, processes, and best practices for continuous data collection, analysis, massive outputs, and presentations/reports.
Manage the BI/BA team by responding to departmental requests and maintaining high levels of performance and quality.
Develop policies and procedures for the collection and analysis
Implement new data analysis methodologies
Using querying techniques to collect and extract data for reporting
Organize and oversee the deployment of data to the data warehouse
Data analysis techniques and technologies, data visualization and modeling, trend identification
Cooperate with IT Department to implement software and hardware upgrades to leverage big data use cases
Balance the line between IT and the business:
Programming, data modeling and statistics
Analytical thinking and problem-solving
Communication
Create or discover new data procurement and processing programs
Monitor analytics and metrics results
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:


Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science, data science, engineering, or a related field
5 + years of work experience Database and data architecture design
5 + years of experience in Data Warehouse Business Intelligence
Deep Knowledge of BI principles, Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, Data Modelling and reporting tools
Proficient in ETL (extract, transform, load)
Excellent knowledge of the most common end-user tools (Excel) and DBMS’s (SQL, Elastic, Redis, Postgres)
Practical experience with programming languages for extracting and manipulating data sets (Python, SQL, R, etc.)
Knowledge of services like Looker and Power BI for creating charts, graphs and other data visualizations
Critical thinking and problem-solving
A good understanding of business practices
Communication skills
Leadership and project management experience



LANGUAGES


ENGLISH Fluent (verbally and written) with excellent communication skills.
Additional Languages will be considered a plus



Benefits and Values - What you can expect from us:

TRAINING: You will work with an experienced and dynamic team, with whom you will grow and expand your professional skills.

VALORISATION: Proactive people with initiative are in our interest: your proposals will always be taken into consideration and, if feasible, we will be happy to put them into practice together.

CONCRETE: We offer a concrete opportunity for professional growth that will allow you to discover and come into direct contact with the challenges and fascination of an unconventional sector related to the digital world. The contract and RAL will be commensurate with experience.

TECHNOLOGY: Technology is the basis of our structure; we provide the necessary supports to perform the activities to the best of our ability. When you arrive, you will find Microsoft or Apple technical equipment at your workstation, depending on the tasks to be performed.

ENVIRONMENTS: Facility equipped with areas for conviviality among colleagues with free coffee and drinks.

Dontouch SA is an equal opportunity employer.

Contract: Permanent employment contract according to Swiss Law (equal to 40 hours per week).

Job location: Chiasso, Canton Ticino (Switzerland) - NO REMOTE

You can apply on LinkedIn or send your CV to hr@dontouch.ch

Please specify the type of projects in which the above-mentioned skills were used.

Applications whose profiles do not meet the above requirements will not be considered.


For non-EU/AELS citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss work permit, DonTouch cannot guarantee your final employment due to authority regulations.

Title: Merchandising Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler®, Lee® and Rock & Republic®, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Job Posting

Merchandising Data Analyst

Location: Geneva // Switzerland

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler® and Lee®. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

What’s the scope?

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.

Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst


Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.


Skills For Success


A Bachelor’s degree and 3–5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal; additional European languages are a plus.
Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and a sharp eye for detail.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate insights clearly and effectively.


We Offer

We value trust, transparency, collaboration, and innovation, and focus on sustainability and teamwork. Our purpose, mission, and values guide us towards continuous growth and leveraging cutting-edge sustainable technologies.

Benefits And Perks Include


Competitive salary package
Discounts on Wrangler® & Lee® brands
Casual denim dress code at work and beyond
A multicultural, diverse, and inclusive workforce with employees from various nationalities
Employee resource groups focused on diversity, sustainability, wellbeing, and social activities
Opportunities for professional development and career growth
Advantages of being part of a global company


Why Kontoor Brands?

At Kontoor, we offer a comprehensive benefit package to fit your lifestyle. Our benefits are crafted with the same care as our products.

When our employees are healthy, secure, and well, they bring their best selves to work. Kontoor Brands supports you with a competitive benefits program that provides choice and flexibility to meet your and your family’s needs – now and in the future. We offer resources to support your physical, emotional, social, and financial wellbeing, plus benefits like discounts on our apparel. Kontoor Brands also provides four weeks of Paid Parental Leave to eligible employees who are new parents, Flexible Fridays, and Tuition Reimbursement.

We are proud to offer a workplace culture centered on equitable opportunities and a sense of belonging for all team members. Here we have a global workforce of high-performing teams that both unlocks our individual uniqueness and harnesses our collaborative talents.

Title: Commercial Data & Analytics Intern
Description:
At Bavarian Nordic, we are committed to saving and improving lives by unlocking the power of the immune system. Our commercial product portfolio includes market-leading vaccines against smallpox, mpox, rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, typhoid fever, and cholera. We excel in R&D innovation, manufacturing, and commercialization, striving to improve people's health and quality of life worldwide, protecting our tomorrow. Join us in our mission to make a difference.

As part of our growth journey, we are looking to strengthen the Commercial Operations Team with a full-time Commercial Data & Analytics Intern. The position can be located in either Denmark, Switzerland, or Germany. The role will work in collaboration with the commercial teams to support data analysis and produce and maintain dashboards to track KPIs.

Join our team and let's make a difference together.

Key responsibilities:


Analyze field force and sales performance data to uncover actionable insights
Build, maintain, and enhance Power BI dashboards to improve reporting and transparency
Track SF performance KPIs to support sales managers' activities and improve sales execution
Ensure data consistency and data quality by performing checks and validations
Support the Data & Analytics team with ad hoc analysis and reporting tasks
Respond to data and analysis requests from commercial stakeholders across departments


Qualifications, preferred skills, and experience:


Bachelor’s degree/completion of a Master´s degree in Statistics, Business, Econometrics, Data Analytics, or a related field
Proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling and DAX, and Excel
Comfortable working with large datasets and complex data structures
Familiarity with CRM systems and marketing automation tools is a big plus
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset
Relevant previous experience is a strong plus


The position is for a min. of 6 months.

We offer the opportunity to work in an international company with unique technology and a dedicated workforce. We welcome people who share our passion with a willingness to make a difference. We offer a dynamic and flexible work environment and an opportunity to develop your personal and academic competencies.

Caught your interest?

If you are ready to take on a pivotal role in a growing organization and drive meaningful change in healthcare, apply now and join Bavarian Nordic in our mission to improve health outcomes and foster sustainable growth.

Founded in 1994, we have +30 years of experience developing life-saving vaccines. We are a global leader in smallpox and mpox vaccines. Our commercial product portfolio contains market-leading vaccines against rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, cholera, typhoid, and Ebola. We are headquartered in Denmark and have manufacturing, research, and sales offices across Europe and North America. Our values – our Bavarian Nordic DNA, as we like to call it – are what guide our actions every day. We act as persistent pioneers, embrace change, value being boosted by the team, and believe in protecting lives every day. If that is also a part of your DNA, we invite you to join us in Bavarian Nordic! Bavarian Nordic is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

www.bavarian-nordic.com

Title: Neuroscientific Data Analysis Internship (Python)
Description:
At MaxWell Biosystems, we develop advanced instrumentation for neuroscience and life sciences applications. Our instruments consist of custom-designed CMOS-based sensor devices, a data acquisition system with FPGAs and our software suite MaxLab Live. As we expand our analytical capabilities, we are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Neuroscientific Data Analysis Intern. You will work closely with our software development teams to assist in the development, validation, and refinement of analysis pipelines for complex biological data. This is a hands-on role where programming skills, analytical thinking, and scientific curiosity will directly contribute to ensuring the accuracy and reliability of research outcomes.

 

Your Responsibilities

Support the development and optimization of analysis workflows for large-scale biological datasets.
Perform systematic quality control on processed data to ensure accuracy, reproducibility, and compliance with internal standards.
Collaborate with scientists and engineers to troubleshoot analysis steps and improve pipeline robustness.
Document analysis procedures and quality control findings clearly and systematically.
Contribute to internal discussions on methods improvement and data interpretation.




Your Profile

Currently pursuing or recently completed a Master’s degree in computer science, data science, neuroscience, biotechnology, or a related field.
Experience with data analysis in Python.
Understanding of electrophysiological data or other biological signal acquisition methods.
Strong problem-solving skills and capacity to work independently as well as collaboratively.
Good communication skills in English (spoken and written).
Eagerness to learn new analysis techniques and adapt to evolving research needs.




Are you motivated to work at the intersection of science, event organization, and operations? Do you want to gain hands-on experience in supporting world-class events that drive innovation in neuroscience and drug discovery?

Join MaxWell Biosystems and contribute to advancing science and improving human health. You’ll work in an international, multidisciplinary environment, collaborating with passionate experts who value curiosity,

ownership, and impact.




Philipp Hornauer looks forward to receiving your application documents by email at hr@mxwbio.com (cover letter, CV).

Show more
HTML:
At MaxWell Biosystems, we develop advanced instrumentation for neuroscience and life sciences applications. Our instruments consist of custom-designed CMOS-based sensor devices, a data acquisition system with FPGAs and our software suite MaxLab Live. As we expand our analytical capabilities, we are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Neuroscientific Data Analysis Intern. You will work closely with our software development teams to assist in the development, validation, and refinement of analysis pipelines for complex biological data. This is a hands-on role where programming skills, analytical thinking, and scientific curiosity will directly contribute to ensuring the accuracy and reliability of research outcomes.

 

Your Responsibilities

  • Support the development and optimization of analysis workflows for large-scale biological datasets.
  • Perform systematic quality control on processed data to ensure accuracy, reproducibility, and compliance with internal standards.
  • Collaborate with scientists and engineers to troubleshoot analysis steps and improve pipeline robustness.
  • Document analysis procedures and quality control findings clearly and systematically.
  • Contribute to internal discussions on methods improvement and data interpretation.


Your Profile

  • Currently pursuing or recently completed a Master’s degree in computer science, data science, neuroscience, biotechnology, or a related field.
  • Experience with data analysis in Python.
  • Understanding of electrophysiological data or other biological signal acquisition methods.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and capacity to work independently as well as collaboratively.
  • Good communication skills in English (spoken and written).
  • Eagerness to learn new analysis techniques and adapt to evolving research needs.


Are you motivated to work at the intersection of science, event organization, and operations? Do you want to gain hands-on experience in supporting world-class events that drive innovation in neuroscience and drug discovery?

Join MaxWell Biosystems and contribute to advancing science and improving human health. You’ll work in an international, multidisciplinary environment, collaborating with passionate experts who value curiosity,

ownership, and impact.


Philipp Hornauer looks forward to receiving your application documents by email at hr@mxwbio.com (cover letter, CV).

Title: Op. Analyst
Description:
Analyst:in für operative Prozesse (80-100%) - Gesundheitsdienstleister

Ein innovatives Unternehmen im Gesundheitswesen sucht eine analytisch starke und kommunikationsfreudige Persönlichkeit zur Verstärkung des Teams im Bereich Operations & Partner Management. Die Position ist ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung zu besetzen.

Was dich erwartet

Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für die Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung eines Netzwerks externer medizinischer Fachpersonen.
Du gestaltest aktiv die Zusammenarbeit mit Partner:innen, führst Vertragsverhandlungen und entwickelst neue Kooperationsmodelle.
Du analysierst wirtschaftliche Kennzahlen und leitest daraus Optimierungspotenziale ab - z.?B. in Bezug auf Infrastruktur, Leistungen oder Abrechnungsmodelle.
Du arbeitest eng mit internen Abteilungen wie Finanzen, IT und Klinikmanagement zusammen und fungierst als zentrale Schnittstelle.
Du entwickelst Standards und Prozesse weiter und sorgst für deren transparente Dokumentation.
Du erstellst Reports und Dashboards auf Basis von Daten aus ERP-, CRM- und BI-Systemen.

Was du mitbringst

Ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Betriebswirtschaft, Gesundheitsökonomie, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit komplexen Datenanalysen und sehr gute Excel-Kenntnisse (inkl. Pivot, Power Query; VBA von Vorteil).
Kenntnisse in der Nutzung von BI-Tools (z.?B. Power BI) sowie ERP- und CRM-Systemen.
Idealerweise erste Berührungspunkte mit medizinischen IT-Systemen und ein gutes Verständnis für Abläufe im Gesundheitswesen.
Kommunikationsstärke, Verhandlungsgeschick und ein lösungsorientierter Arbeitsstil.
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.

Was geboten wird

Eine abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Eigenverantwortung.
Ein unterstützendes Team mit offener Feedbackkultur.
Moderne Arbeitsbedingungen und attraktive Zusatzleistungen.
Ein zentral gelegener Arbeitsplatz mit guter Anbindung an den öffentlichen Verkehr.

Sollten Sie Fragen oder Schwierigkeiten bei der Bewerbung haben, wenden Sie sich bitte an Nur Ergiydiren unter der n.ergiydiren@proclinical.com.

Proclinical ist eine spezialisierte Personalberatung, die berufliche Chancen in der pharmazeutischen, biopharmazeutischen, biotechnologischen und medizintechnischen Branche anbietet.

Proclinical Staffing ist außerdem ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit.

Title: Intern in Data Analysis within Process Development (100%)
Description:
Get to know Climeworks

Climeworks is a leading high-quality carbon removal provider, combining decades of expertise in Direct Air Capture (DAC) technology with a holistic approach to carbon removal solutions.

Climeworks advises companies on their carbon removal strategies and provides tailored portfolios of nature-based and engineered approaches, offering end-to-end services to help achieve net-zero goals. The company runs the world's first two DAC plants in Iceland, demonstrating its core commitment to high-quality carbon removal that is backed by over 15 years of pioneering research, development, and deployment.

By advancing the most reliable solutions in the market, Climeworks accelerates the global transition to net zero, unlocking economic value for businesses, governments, and society.

We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the world’s greatest challenge.

Will you join us?

Job description


Process development support: You actively support the Process Development team in tasks related to testing facilities, operational plants, and future projects.
Data analysis and visualization: You develop tools and visualizations to analyze the performance of testing facilities and operational plants.
Field testing and modeling: You participate in field tests, aggregate collected data, and use it to improve our modeling capabilities.
KPI development: You support the definition, implementation, and documentation of KPIs for testing and operational facilities.
Anomaly detection: You contribute to setting up anomaly detection and alerting systems for testing facilities and operational plants.


Your Story
Job requirements


Educational background: You hold or are pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
Technical skills: You bring experience with Python and SQL, with additional MATLAB skills as a plus.
Learning mindset: You are eager to learn new concepts, skills, and tools needed to complete assignments.
Work style: You are reliable, performance-driven, and structured, thriving both independently and in fast-paced team environments.
Language and availability: You are fluent in English (German is an advantage) and available for a full-time 6-month internship starting in March/April 2025.


Our promise: At Climeworks, you are accepted for who you are, and we are committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply – regardless of background, identity, or experience. Studies show that women and individuals from minority backgrounds often only apply for jobs when they meet 100% of the listed criteria. If this sounds like you, don’t hold back. If you think you’d make a great fit for this role, we’d love to hear from you, even if you don’t check every single box. Let’s tackle one of humankind’s greatest challenges together.

What We Offer

At Climeworks, our six-month internships offer a hybrid work setup, giving you flexibility while ensuring valuable collaboration by working onsite at least three days per week. To maintain fairness, we follow a standardized salary process based on market benchmarks. For our internships based in Switzerland, the compensation is:


During BSc & MSc: CHF 2,000 per month
After completion of MSc: CHF 2,500 per month


Note: We do not accept candidate profiles through recruitment agencies.

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Expleo propose une offre unique de services intégrés d'ingénierie, qualité et conseil stratégique pour la transformation digitale. Dans un contexte d'accélération technologique sans précédent, nous sommes le partenaire de confiance des entreprises qui innovent. Nous les aidons à développer un avantage compétitif et à améliorer le quotidien de millions de personnes.

Intégrer Expleo Switzerland, C’est 19 000 Collaborateurs, Dans 30 Pays, Avec €1.4Md De CA En 2024, Mais Également


Avoir un accompagnement technique et humain à chaque projet et un suivi performant de votre carrière
Réaliser des formations pour développer ses capacités professionnelles
Participer à des événements spéciaux dédiés
Intégrer une équipe dynamique


Data Analyst (H/F)

Pour accompagner notre développement en Suisse, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale se ra d'exploiter et interpréter les données afin de proposer des observations stratégiques.

Missions


Créer et administrer des modèles de données et assurer leur mise à jour régulière automatique
Collecter, nettoyer et exploiter des données issues de diverses sources pour produire des indicateurs fiables
Concevoir des dashboards, définir des KPIs et assurer le reporting aux différentes équipes
Structurer un processus de gestion des demandes d’analyse
Fournir des analyses approfondies et formuler des recommandations au management
Maintenir et optimiser les outils d’analyse pour garantir leur accessibilité aux utilisateurs internes
Former et accompagner les équipes à la lecture et à l’utilisation des indicateurs
Animer les échanges autour des données, promouvoir l’amélioration continue et renforcer la culture Data
Assurer une veille sur les outils et méthodes d’analyse


Profil Recherché


Diplôme en science des données, informatique, statistiques ou équivalent
Expérience en analyse de données et gestion de projets
Maîtrise des outils de traitement, visualisation et diffusion des données
Esprit d’analyse, curiosité, autonomie et sens du travail en équipe
Bonne capacité de communication et d’adaptation aux interlocuteurs variés


Seules les candidatures des citoyens suisses et de l'UE seront prises en compte / Nos postes sont accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap / Télétravail possible

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
We are looking for a Data Modeler to join our client, a leading financial institution in Zurich.




This is a contracting role with the initial duration until the end of 2026.




Key Responsibilities:

Capture and model data requirements, including data definitions, business rules, data quality standards, and logical data models.
Conduct impact assessments for application re-wiring by analyzing and mapping as-is vs. to-be data entities.
Design logical and physical data models following best practices to ensure high data quality and reduce redundancy.
Collaborate closely with the Chief Data Office and business stakeholders to map data entities to the Enterprise Data Catalog.
Work with development teams to implement data strategies, build data flows, and support the development of conceptual data models.




Required Skills & Experience:

Strong expertise in data-driven and integrated reference architectures, with solid knowledge of banking data products, financial data classification, and metadata management tools.
Experienced in agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, SAFe), data modeling standards and tools, and certified through relevant trainings.
Excellent business stakeholder management, cross-functional collaboration between IT and business, and the ability to navigate challenges under pressure with strong interpersonal skills.




Required languages:

English and German




If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across the company. As part of our central data team, you will collaborate closely with analysts from various Business Units and our data engineering team to ensure we have the highest quality data. Your analytical insights will directly influence the direction of our tools and key company objectives.

If you thrive on breaking down complexity into actionable tasks using data, are excited about working on innovative and fast-evolving ideas, and are passionate about leveraging data to protect and enhance privacy for millions of users worldwide, we would love to hear from you!

What You Will Do



Design and visualise new KPIs capturing product success and actionable insights able to uncover new opportunities.
Monitor and Synthesize KPIs to create reports capturing key company and cross-product level insights, challenging the status quo.
Translate company-level goals into analytical tasks to ensure a data-driven approach.
Collaborate closely with engineering teams to increase the quality and usability of our data within a privacy-first ecosystem.
Mentor junior team members on statistical techniques and exploratory data analysis to achieve the right balance of analytical proficiency and business impact.
Maintain and improve our A/B testing framework within our privacy-first in-house tool used by all data analysts to evaluate and document A/B tests.
Empower stakeholders to make data-driven decisions by developing training sessions on how to use and extract insights from our dashboards.



Job Requirements



Minimum 6 years' work experience as a Data Analyst with focus on statistics, data exploration and visualisation.
Solid statistical background and experience in conducting hypothesis testing, A/B analysis and exploratory analysis.
Ability to work large business concepts into actionable analytical tasks, including handling uncertainty and open-ended problems.
Excellent knowledge of SQL and at least one programming language, preferably Python.
Proven track record of prioritizing effectively and working independently in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
Great communication skills, with the ability to adapt to both technical and non-technical audiences to achieve results.



Bonus points for:



Previous experience mentoring team members.
Hands on experience with Metabase, Clickhouse, Git and Spark.
Previous experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) products and data privacy applications



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.


Show more

If you thrive on breaking down complexity into actionable tasks using data, are excited about working on innovative and fast-evolving ideas, and are passionate about leveraging data to protect and enhance privacy for millions of users worldwide, we would love to hear from you!

What You Will Do


  • Design and visualise new KPIs capturing product success and actionable insights able to uncover new opportunities.
  • Monitor and Synthesize KPIs to create reports capturing key company and cross-product level insights, challenging the status quo.
  • Translate company-level goals into analytical tasks to ensure a data-driven approach.
  • Collaborate closely with engineering teams to increase the quality and usability of our data within a privacy-first ecosystem.
  • Mentor junior team members on statistical techniques and exploratory data analysis to achieve the right balance of analytical proficiency and business impact.
  • Maintain and improve our A/B testing framework within our privacy-first in-house tool used by all data analysts to evaluate and document A/B tests.
  • Empower stakeholders to make data-driven decisions by developing training sessions on how to use and extract insights from our dashboards.


Job Requirements


  • Minimum 6 years' work experience as a Data Analyst with focus on statistics, data exploration and visualisation.
  • Solid statistical background and experience in conducting hypothesis testing, A/B analysis and exploratory analysis.
  • Ability to work large business concepts into actionable analytical tasks, including handling uncertainty and open-ended problems.
  • Excellent knowledge of SQL and at least one programming language, preferably Python.
  • Proven track record of prioritizing effectively and working independently in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
  • Great communication skills, with the ability to adapt to both technical and non-technical audiences to achieve results.


Bonus points for:


  • Previous experience mentoring team members.
  • Hands on experience with Metabase, Clickhouse, Git and Spark.
  • Previous experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) products and data privacy applications


What We Offer


  • Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
  • Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
  • Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
  • Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
  • Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
  • Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
  • Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
  • Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
  • Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: (Junior) Consultant
Description:
Du bist ein Young Professional und suchst eine Herausforderung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Marktforschung und Unternehmensberatung als:




(Junior) Consultant




Pensum: 100 Prozent Stellenantritt: nach Vereinbarung


Aufgaben



Betreuung von Forschungs- und Beratungsmandaten über alle Phasen des Projekt-managements


Durchführung von Workshops


Erstellen von Kunden- und Marktanalysen


Teilnahme bei Kundenmeetings


Unterstützung bei der Kundengewinnung



Qualifikation



Masterabschluss in Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften

(Universität oder Fachhochschule)


Zahlenaffin und Kompetenzen in empirischen Methoden sowie R-/R-Stuio-Kenntnisse


Sicheres Auftreten und gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch


Hohes Engagement, belastbar und effiziente Arbeitsweise


Erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Marktforschung, Beratung oder Marketing von Vorteil



Benefits



Professionelles Consulting-Umfeld auf anspruchsvollem, internationalem Niveau mit namhaften Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Wirtschaftsbranchen


Kleines, dynamisches Team im Zürcher Technopark – vernetzt mit Spezialist:innen in der DACH-Region


Selbstständige und flexible Arbeitseinteilung mit Möglichkeit von Home Office


Einblicke in das gesamte Unternehmen


Offenes und entspanntes Arbeitsklima, wo eigene Ideen auf Resonanz stossen.





Wir sind ein international tätiges Beratungs- und Researchunternehmen, spezialisiert auf eine effiziente und effektive Marktbearbeitung. Wir verknüpfen Zielgruppen, Touchpoints und Inhalte und holen so messbar das Maximum aus den Investitionen unserer Auftraggeber.




Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Title: Cat Data and Tools Analyst - temporary contract 6-9 months
Description:
PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.




Job Description

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).

The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.

This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team on a project in collaboration with PartnerRe’s Capital Management team focusing on automating data processing and enhancing reporting and analytics capabilities.

In more detail your main tasks are to:

Migrate the financial model cashflow engine from Excel to R
Design and implement an appropriate database structure for storing inputs and outputs
Develop dashboard to support structuring and portfolio reporting
Automate the production of existing reports
Establish and manage the solution documentation

The role will be based in Zurich.




Qualifications

You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.

The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:

Master degree in computer science, data engineering, or a related quantitative field
Strong programming skills in R or Python
Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
Experience with databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals
Proficient (written and verbal) in English

You are either an EU or Swiss citizen, or entitled to work in Switzerland.




Additional Information

We can offer you the opportunity to work on applying your programming skills in applied projects. You will work in an international environment, where you can learn from Senior Experts, and get insights into the reinsurance business.

One of PartnerRe’s core strengths is its technical know-how, built over many years of investment in the right people working on the challenges of quantifying and managing cat risk. Be that person and join us!




PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

Thank you,

PartnerRe Hiring Team

Title: Data Engineer H/F
Description:
📢 𝗤𝗨𝗜 𝗘𝗦𝗧 𝗥𝗘𝗗𝗦𝗘𝗡 ?




Redsen est un cabinet de conseil de 160 collaborateurs en 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗱𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗲𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗴𝗮𝗻𝗶𝘀𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗲. Cela signifie que notre mission est d’accompagner nos clients lors de leurs projets informatiques et métiers de 3 manières :




✅ Conseil stratégique et opérationnel

✅ Mise à disposition d’expertises

✅ Développement technique par le biais de notre centre de services




Dans le cadre d’une mission, nous recherchons un(e) Data Engineer pour renforcer nos équipes et intervenir auprès de nos clients sur des projets stimulants.




📍 Envie d’un nouveau défi ? Regardez s’il vous correspond ! 👇







📝 VOS MISSIONS PRINCIPALES




Concevoir, implémenter et maintenir des pipelines de données performants, évolutifs et optimisés sur Databricks, en assurant leur migration depuis les systèmes existants et leur intégration dans des workflows CI/CD.
Déployer, administrer et surveiller les pipelines et la plateforme Databricks via des pratiques d’automatisation et de CI/CD, en garantissant leur disponibilité, leur intégrité et leurs performances.
Collaborer avec les équipes internes et les parties prenantes pour comprendre les besoins métier et proposer des solutions analytiques adaptées.
Structurer et préparer les données en collaboration avec les ingénieurs data pour répondre aux besoins d’analyse et de reporting.
Réaliser des analyses exploratoires pour identifier des modèles, tendances et insights à forte valeur ajoutée.
Concevoir, développer et maintenir des tableaux de bord et rapports décisionnels clairs et exploitables.
Fournir un support technique aux utilisateurs internes exploitant Databricks et accompagner leur montée en compétence.
Rédiger et mettre à jour la documentation technique, tout en assurant une veille technologique pour identifier des opportunités d’amélioration, d’innovation et d’optimisation des processus CI/CD.







💼 VOTRE PROFIL




Diplômé(e) d'études supérieures en systèmes d'information (École d’ingénieurs / HES / Master) avec au minimum 5 ans d'expérience comme Data Engineer
Exellente maitrise de Databricks
Excellente maîtrise de Python et des bonnes pratiques d’ingénierie logicielle
Compétences avancées en SQL pour la conception et l’optimisation de requêtes et de workflows de données, avec une bonne maîtrise de Git et des pipelines CI/CD
Bonne connaissance des environnements cloud AWS et/ou Azure, ainsi que de leurs principaux services de traitement et stockage (Lambda, Functions, S3, RDS, etc.)
Idéalement vous connaissez Terraform
Maîtrise du français (langue maternelle ou niveau C1 minimum) et de l’anglais (niveau B2 minimum).




📌 INFORMATIONS DU POSTE




📄Type de contrat : CDI

📅Date de début : début octobre au plus tard

📍Localisation : Genève (résidence suisse souhaitée au démarrage)

💻Télétravail : Oui, selon les règles en vigueur pour les frontaliers & clients







🎁 POURQUOI REDSEN SUISSE ?




Rejoignez un cabinet à taille humaine, indépendant, au service de clients variés.
Profitez d’un cadre exceptionnel en Suisse : qualité de vie, nature⛰, activités, culture, ...
📈Une évolution qui suit votre ambition : un plan de carrière personnalisé et l'accès à des formations et certifications.
🤝Un accompagnement sur mesure : un management de proximité et une équipe RH toujours disponible pour vous guider dès votre arrivée et vous soutenir lors de vos missions.
Les activités insolites de la Redsen League : poterie, wakesurf, paddle, stand de tir, quizzroom… et bien sûr, le week-end ski ! ⛷




Un cabinet engagé dans la Responsabilité Sociétale et Environnementale, reconnue par la certification B Corp 🌱




Vous souhaitez rejoindre l’aventure Redsen ?




📩 Candidatez dès maintenant ! 🚀😊

Show more

Title: Palantir Specialist
Description:
ALTEN Group

Within 30 years, ALTEN has become leader in both outsourced Engineering and IT Enterprise Services. ALTEN, composed of 54,000 employees (88% engineers), carries out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of 6,500 clients, the most prestigious companies in all sectors of industry, services and telecommunications. We work with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defense & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.




ALTEN Switzerland

Since 2005, with 450 current employees, ALTEN Switzerland is a reference partner in providing Engineering services to 100 world leading companies. ALTEN Switzerland’s activities cover all the main strategical areas of the Swiss market in Life Sciences, Engineering & IT Services.




____________




Join ALTEN Switzerland as a Palantir Specialist and take on the challenge of designing, configuring and managing advanced data solutions using Palantir Foundry for a key client in the financial sector.




Key Responsibilities

Configure and maintain Palantir platforms to meet evolving business needs;
Develop custom data models, dashboards and workflows for advanced analytics;
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate requirements into effective solutions;
Train and support end-users to maximize platform adoption and value.




Your profile

Hands-on experience with Palantir Foundry;
Strong skills in data engineering and data analysis;
Familiarity with AI and machine learning is preferred;
Fluent English is required; German language skills are a plus;
Background in engineering, computer science or related fields is preferred.




Location: Canton of Zurich (on-site with hybrid flexibility).




What we offer you

At ALTEN, you benefit from a permanent contract, access to cutting-edge projects with top-tier clients and opportunities for both national and international growth. We support your development with certified trainings in technical and soft skills.




Apply now and grow with us – we believe in building the future together!




___

ALTEN Switzerland AG

Hardturmstrasse 11

8005 Zürich

Tel. +41 (0) 79 103 45 63

__
