Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Genève.




1.Conception et spécification des exigences

Concevoir l'architecture fonctionnelle du data hub
Modéliser les référentiels métier
Définir les modèles de données selon les bonnes pratiques (Data Vault, dimensionnel)
Rédiger les spécifications fonctionnelles détaillées pour les développements ETL
Cartographier l'écosystème de données existant (bases, fichiers, APIs)




2. Gestion avancée de la qualité des données

Définir le framework qualité global du data hub
Concevoir les indicateurs et métriques de qualité par domaine
Élaborer les processus de contrôle et de validation des données
Spécifier les règles métier de cohérence et de complétude
Concevoir les tableaux de bord de pilotage de la qualité
Définir les alertes et seuils critiques par référentiel
Réaliser le profiling approfondi des sources de données
Documenter les constats et recommandations qualité




3. Gouvernance et pilotage

Participer à la gouvernance des données
Collaborer avec les data stewards métier des différents offices
Contribuer aux comités techniques transversaux
Rédiger la documentation technique et fonctionnelle des référentiels
Assurer le support fonctionnel des utilisateurs des référentiels




Pré-requis du poste

Diplôme d’ingénieur ou formation universitaire en informatique, statistiques ou mathématiques appliquées.
Expérience confirmée de plus de 10 ans d’expérience dont des expériences significatives en analyse de données et en conception de solutions associées.
Excellente maîtrise des bases de données relationnelles (PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle).
Compétences avérées en outils de data quality et profiling (Informatica).
Solides connaissances en Master Data Management et gouvernance des données.
Capacité à vulgariser des concepts techniques et à guider des équipes.
Aisance relationnelle pour travailler avec différents métiers
Une expérience en méthodologie agile ou en gestion de projet (Hermes, PMP).




Profil local (basé en Suisse ou en zone frontalière)




Rejoindre Sword, c’est…

💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation

🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an

🚑 Une couverture assurance-accident internationale

🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité

🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale

🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité

🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

HTML:
Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Genève.


1.Conception et spécification des exigences

  • Concevoir l'architecture fonctionnelle du data hub
  • Modéliser les référentiels métier
  • Définir les modèles de données selon les bonnes pratiques (Data Vault, dimensionnel)
  • Rédiger les spécifications fonctionnelles détaillées pour les développements ETL
  • Cartographier l'écosystème de données existant (bases, fichiers, APIs)


2. Gestion avancée de la qualité des données

  • Définir le framework qualité global du data hub
  • Concevoir les indicateurs et métriques de qualité par domaine
  • Élaborer les processus de contrôle et de validation des données
  • Spécifier les règles métier de cohérence et de complétude
  • Concevoir les tableaux de bord de pilotage de la qualité
  • Définir les alertes et seuils critiques par référentiel
  • Réaliser le profiling approfondi des sources de données
  • Documenter les constats et recommandations qualité


3. Gouvernance et pilotage

  • Participer à la gouvernance des données
  • Collaborer avec les data stewards métier des différents offices
  • Contribuer aux comités techniques transversaux
  • Rédiger la documentation technique et fonctionnelle des référentiels

Pré-requis du poste

  • Diplôme d’ingénieur ou formation universitaire en informatique, statistiques ou mathématiques appliquées.

  • Excellente maîtrise des bases de données relationnelles (PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle).
  • Compétences avérées en outils de data quality et profiling (Informatica).
  • Solides connaissances en Master Data Management et gouvernance des données.
  • Capacité à vulgariser des concepts techniques et à guider des équipes.
  • Aisance relationnelle pour travailler avec différents métiers
  • Une expérience en méthodologie agile ou en gestion de projet (Hermes, PMP).

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data & Analytics Platform Lead - (a)- Festanstellung - (2078)
Description:
Die smiti AG in Horgen ist spezialisiert auf Verleih und Vermittlung von Spezialisten in den Bereichen IT, HR, Sales, Finance, Marketing und Merchandise.

Für unseren Kunden im Raum Basel suchen wir einen/e Data & Analytics Platform Lead - (a)- Festanstellung - (2078)




Aufgaben

Technische Verantwortung für Datenplattform, ETL/ELT-Prozesse und BI-Lösungen
Umsetzung mit Databricks, Azure Data Factory, dbt, Power BI
Führung eines verteilten Entwicklerteams (SCRUM) inkl. Offshore-Koordination
Sicherstellung von Codequalität, Automatisierung (CI/CD), Monitoring
Optimierung hinsichtlich Datenqualität, Performance und Governance




Profil

Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Data Science o. Ä.
mind. 5 Jahre Erfahrung als Data Engineer oder in ähnlicher Rolle
Erfahrung in Power BI, Tableau oder Qlik
Erfahrung in Cloud-Datenplattformen wie Databricks, Snowflake, BigQuery
Erfahrung in Python und SQL
Erfahrung in Teamführung und technischer Projektverantwortung
sehr gute Englischkenntnisse und gute Deutsch Kenntnisse
Azure-Erfahrung (Data Factory, DevOps)
CI/CD, Docker, Infrastructure as Code
Kenntnisse in MLOps, Data Vault, Datenschutz




Gerne erwarten wir deine Bewerbungsunterlagen (CV und Zeugnisse in DE)

Deniz Dülek, deniz.duelek@smiti.ch, 078 816 18 55




👉 Tipp für deine nächsten Bewerbungen:

Stell dir vor, du könntest deinen Lebenslauf mit nur wenigen Klicks in ein echtes Meisterwerk verwandeln – genau das macht unsere neue CV-Plattform möglich!

Ob Berufseinsteiger:in oder erfahrene:r Profi – www.freshcv.ch hilft dir, deine Stärken optimal zu präsentieren. Warum warten? Teste noch heute, wie du deinen Lebenslauf aufs nächste Level bringst! 🫵

Title: Internship Digital Chemistry Bayesian optimisation
Description:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all – while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Job Description

Join our Data Manufacturing Excellence and Chemistry Research teams as a Data Analytics Intern. We offer two internships: one optimizing global production processes for cost and sustainability, and another enhancing chemical target selection in research.

Both projects use cutting-edge Bayesian statistical modeling techniques to improve decision-making. You'll develop predictive models to boost manufacturing efficiency and candidate selection accuracy.

This opportunity provides exposure to real-life data from research and production, involves high-impact projects on operational efficiency and sustainability, and offers insight into a large organization's research and manufacturing operations.

Ideal for those passionate about data analysis, data science, and development.

Planned duration of the internship: 4-6 months, start date will be negotiated later (flexible)

Main Responsibilities


Work with Research and Production departments
Develop a methodology to optimize cost, sustainability impact and chemical yield
Work on a concrete case study, on one of our Active Ingredient currently on market
Identify key drivers of chemical process to be optimized
Analyze variable production cost data from 5 international manufacturing sites based in UK, Switzerland, France, USA & Brazil
Develop predictive models to anticipate cost variations
Build predictive models in R or Python (eg using PyMC and SciPy optimize packages for Bayesian inference)
Create and maintain data flows and interactive dashboards to visualize variable product cost KPIs
Participate in the development of decision support tools for cost optimization
Collaborate with international teams to standardize data collection and analysis practices
Make larger analysis on other sites including 5 sites in UK, Switzerland, France, USA & Brazil


Qualifications


BAC+5 student, Master's or Engineering School, specialized in Data Science, you are looking for a 6-month end-of-year internship.
You have knowledge of programming languages, Python, SQL
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and statistical analysis
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and statistical methods is required
Rigorous and organized, you respect quality/deadline constraints and know how to adapt your work organization according to the priorities given.
Good communicator and naturally curious, you easily discuss the progress of your activities, the problems encountered and work in a spirit of continuous service improvement.
Your interpersonal skills allow you to integrate easily into teams.
Given the company's international environment, an intermediate level of written/read English (email exchanges, meetings, technical documents...) is required at minimum.
Valid driver's license required for site access.


Additional Information

What we offer


An international experience in a multicultural environment
Exposure to concrete large-scale cost optimization projects
Possibility to publish on methodologies utilized while keeping confidential information on Syngenta knowledge
Mentoring by data experts
Opportunity to travel to different production sites


Interested? We are looking for your application! Along with your Cover letter and CV please provide a Research Summary of 2-5 pages.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Health Promotion Switzerland recognizes Syngenta's commitment to the health and well-being of its employees and awards the "Friendly Work Space" label to all its Swiss sites. At Syngenta, employee health and well-being are key to the company.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer

Zürich/Fribourg




Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!







So schaffst du Mehrwert

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.




Deine Hauptaufgaben:

Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.




Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil







Optionale Superkräfte:

Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus




🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data Center Operations Analyst (Geneva)
Description:
Company Description

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

Job Description

Data Center Operations Team manages the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center. Oversees systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships. Responsible for capacity planning and continual assessments for process improvement to ensure that processes are well-documented, sustainable, and scalable. Monitors ongoing practices to ensure consistency with policies, compliance regulations and control requirements. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Roles can have an internal or external client focus. May involve company-hosted, Web-enabled solutions or may include project-based jobs in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.

This role is primarily based at our data centre facility in Geneva.

What You Get To Do In This Role


Prioritize and assign trouble tickets to data center engineers.
Manage the performance of data center operations with varying skills across Switzerland location.
Ensure effective and efficient management of day-to-day data center operations including queue management, 7/24 shift arrangement and hardware logistics.
Subject matter expert across all aspects in data center operations especially in DCIM integrations.
Ensure all operational KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and metrics are being measured and met.
Responsible for reporting key metrics to peer teams.
Inspire and guide improvement in team process, technology innovation and automation.
Manage Large Scale Events, Incident management - responsible for communications to executive stakeholders.
Manage and build workflows for data centers operations.
Has a solid understanding of all critical Mechanical & Electrical infrastructure.
Recommend, document, and oversee policies and procedures to meet industry best practices and to meet required SLAs (Service Level Agreement).
Maintain the on-call schedule coordinating absence and vacations.
Be passionate about the quality and quantity of services being provided, and continuously strive to improve our Customer Experience.


Qualifications

To be successful in this role you have:


4+ years of experience in data center operations management
Experience of managing the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center.
Holistic experience of overseeing systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships.
Experience of capacity planning and continual assessments for DC.
Good knowledge of data center facilities and infrastructure including power, HVAC, structured cabling, rack management and security.
Experience managing vendors in a data center environment.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task several unrelated issues.
General documentation skills with particular emphasis on technical processes and standards.
Knowledge and experience in ITIL process methodologies a plus.
Proven ability to function in ambiguous situations with a record of success.
Excellent communication, customer focus, problem solving, conflict management, time management and interpersonal skills required.
A deep passion for Sustainability and compliance to support our customers global impact responsibilities .
Some travel would be required--domestically and internationally.


Although data center experience is key, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and positive with a passion for developing new skills.

What You Can Expect From Us

At ServiceNow, we make work better for everyone – including our own employees. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible for our employees. Win as a Team is part of our culture, and we aspire to wow our customers. We stay hungry and humble and focus on creating belonging. Sustainability, inclusivity, and diversity are key focus areas within our business framework so that we have transparency, equity, and accountability to deliver meaningful, measurable change. With our vision and dedication for a better future already underway. Join us on this journey!

Benefits

In addition to a competitive salary, supportive teams, and a real opportunity to progress in your career with a forward-thinking organisation, we provide resources to help you and your loved ones be well. From benefits plans and programs, to mental health resources that offer coaching and 24/7 support, to family support resources and parental leave programs – we want to help you take care of yourself and your loved ones. Below is a glimpse into even more of our offerings or click here for a full list:


Along with holidays, we have company-wide designated global well-being days where everyone is off and can spend time doing what matters most.
Good working culture to support the balance you need in both work and life.
Parental leave programs.
Childcare and caregiving benefits.
A learning experience platform built using our own technology, to support your learning and development goals as well as a tuition reimbursement program.
A global, cross-functional mentoring program.
We also have team building activities, various employee belonging groups, volunteering, and community outreach programs.

Additional Information

Work Personas

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

Equal Opportunity Employer

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

Accommodations

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

Export Control Regulations

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

From Fortune. ©2025 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

Title: Data Engineer Intern
Description:
Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:


EU / EEA citizenship
Must be graduating within or after November 2025


These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let’s talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:


Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.


What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?


Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.


Competences Required:


Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.


A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.

We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:


The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.


What’s In It For You

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential—fueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people—you can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:


Participate in dedicated skill-building workshops
Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership


In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:


A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands


Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!

HTML:
Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:

  • EU / EEA citizenship
  • Must be graduating within or after November 2025

These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let’s talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
  • Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
  • Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
  • Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
  • Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.

What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?

  • Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
  • Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
  • Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
  • Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
  • Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.

Competences Required:

  • Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
  • Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
  • Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
  • Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Show more

Title: HR Data Analyst 80 - 100 %
Description:
Luzern

Eine Aufgabe bei der Suva ist weit mehr, als einfach nur seiner Arbeit nachzugehen. Bei uns kannst du dich einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen. Du nimmst eine Vorbildfunktion in der Prävention von Unfällen wahr und leistest deinen persönlichen Beitrag zur Sicherheit der Bevölkerung bei Arbeit und Freizeit – genauso wie weitere rund 4500 Mitarbeitende. Wir bieten ein stabiles und modernes Umfeld. Lass dich überraschen und wachse mit uns.

Was du bewegst


Du stellst die geeignete HR-Datengrundlage sowie das Personaldatenreporting und die Statistiken sicher.
Für die Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung von Datenanalysen bist du verantwortlich und förderst datenbasierte Entscheidungen.
Auswertungen von Befragungen führst du durch, interpretierst sie und berätst HR-interne Stakeholder, während du Trends und Innovationen im Bereich Data & Analytics beobachtest.
Bei der Weiterentwicklung der HR Cloud Applikationen im Rahmen der HR IT-Strategie unterstützt du.
Du wirkst bei der Auswahl und Einführung neuer Technologien und Best Practices mit.



Was wir erwarten


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung.
Du verfügst über Wissen zu Methodiken und Instrumenten der Datenanalyse, -aufbereitung und -interpretation.
SAP HCM/SuccessFactors-Kenntnisse bringst du idealerweise mit.
Du zeigst ausgeprägte Analysefähigkeiten und hast eine gewisse Affinität zu HR-Themen.
Du bist flexibel, zeigst Pioniergeist und hast Freude an neuen Aufgabenstellungen sowie an der Mitgestaltung von Zukunftsthemen.
Deutsch beherrschst du auf muttersprachlichem Niveau. Gute Französisch- und Englischkenntnisse erleichtern dir die Arbeit.



Was uns auszeichnet


Life-Balance ist uns wichtig. Deshalb bieten wir moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle und zentrumsnahe Standorte.
Wir leben Wertschätzung und ein unkompliziertes und kollegiales Miteinander.
Bei uns gibt es viele abwechslungsreiche Arbeitsinhalte mit hohem Gestaltungsspielraum.
Bei der Suva arbeiten macht und stiftet Sinn.



Wer sich auf dich freut

Katarina Pavlovic

Talent Acquisition Manager

041 419 6521
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Zürich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months


Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines


Month 3-4


Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.


Month 5-onwards


Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.


Qualifications


A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes
Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.


Additional Information


This position offers Hybrid working conditions and is subject to change at any time.
Candidate is required to work in the Zürich office 4 days per week with 1 day being remote.
This position does not offer Visa Sponsorship opportunities.


Friendly, personable and often surprisingly uncomplicated, that's how many of our employees describe their working relationships at Sika. We call this the Sika Spirit

We offer a fair employment package with good social benefits

We look forward to your direct online application.
Show more

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months

  • Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
  • Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
  • Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
  • Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines

Month 3-4

  • Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
  • Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
  • Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.

Month 5-onwards

  • Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
  • Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
  • Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
  • Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.

Qualifications

  • A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
  • Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
  • Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
  • Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
  • Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
  • Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
  • Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes
  • Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

Additional Information

  • This position offers Hybrid working conditions and is subject to change at any time.
  • Candidate is required to work in the Zürich office 4 days per week with 1 day being remote.
  • This position does not offer Visa Sponsorship opportunities.

Friendly, personable and often surprisingly uncomplicated, that's how many of our employees describe their working relationships at Sika. We call this the Sika Spirit

We offer a fair employment package with good social benefits

We look forward to your direct online application.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: ICT Data Analyst*in mit Schwerpunkt Power BI 80-100%
Description:
Zürich

Informatik

80% - 100%

Zur Erweiterung unseres Teams im Fachbereich Informatik suchen wir eine*n ICT Data Analyst*in mit Schwerpunkt Power BI

Stellenantritt: 1. November 2025 oder nach Vereinbarung

Ihre Aufgaben


Sie übernehmen den Aufbau einer modernen, cloudbasierten BI-Plattform mit Fokus auf Azure-Komponenten und stellen deren Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung sicher.
Sie sind verantwortlich für die Entwicklung und Pflege skalierbarer Power BI-Lösungen, die Sicherstellung von Datenqualität und Performence sowie für die technische Dokumentation und für Releases.
Sie führen komplexe Datananalysen zur Bereitstellung entscheidungsrelevanter Daten für die Fachbereiche sowie Ad-hoc-Auswertungen durch.
Sie unterstützen beim Aufbau einer Self-Service BI-Umgebung, beraten die Fachabteilungen und führen Schulungen durch.
Sie sind eng im Austausch mit Stakeholdern aus unterschiedlichen Bereichen und leiten kleinere Projekte oder Teilprojekte.


Ihr Profil


Ausbildung auf Niveau EFZ und abgeschlossene höhere Fachausbildung auf Niveau HFP wie beispielsweise ein Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder in Betriebswirtschaft mit Vertiefung Informatik
Weiterführende Weiterbildung ITIL Foundation
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst im Umfeld Power BI
Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Dashboards, Datenmodellen und automatisierten Datenpipelines
Know-how im Prozessmanagement und Freude an innovativen Ideen und Lösungen
Ausgeprägte Kunden- und Dienstleistungsorientierung
Überzeugendes Auftreten sowie ausgeprägte kommunikative Fähigkeiten


Wir bieten Ihnen


Ein verantwortungsvolles, vielseitiges und anspruchsvolles Aufgabengebiet in einem spannenden und dynamischen Umfeld
4-6 Wochen Ferien pro Jahr, je nach Alter und Funktionsstufe sowie zusätzliche 6 Betriebsferientage pro Jahr
Diverse Vergünstigungen, z.B. bei Mobility Carsharing, Mobile Abos und wahlweise einen Beitrag an die Verpflegungskosten (Lunch Checks)
Mobiles Arbeiten nach Möglichkeit
Sie profitieren von einer der besten Pensionskassen in Zürich und von einem individuellen Weiterbildungsangebot


Ihr Arbeitsort

Eggbühlstrasse 15, 8050 Zürich, Schweiz

Play

Pause

Ton aus

Zum Anfang
Show more

Title: Laboranten - (Senior) Analyst LBS oder LC-MS 100%
Description:
Aufgrund des stetigen Wachstums unseres Unternehmens und zur Verstärkung unseres bioanalytischen Labors in Fehraltorf/Zürich suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung mehrere engagierte Persönlichkeiten als

(Senior) Analyst LBS oder LC-MS 100%

Wir bieten Dir

Eine verantwortungsvolle Arbeit in einem offenen und dynamischen Team

On the job Weiterbildung und Entwicklung

Vielseitige Mitarbeit in unterschiedlichen Projekten

Moderne Infrastruktur

Work-Life-Balance: flexible Arbeitszeiten (Mo bis Fr, keine Wochenenden, keine Schicht), mind. 5 Wochen Ferien

Finanzielles: Lohngleichheit zwischen den Geschlechtern, sehr gute Sozialleistungen, Bezug von REKA-Checks

Das bringst Du mit

Chemielaborant/in, Biologielaborant/in, CTA, BTA oder MTA

Erfahrung in der Aufbereitung biologischen Probenmaterials

Sehr gute Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Biochemie und/oder Chromatographie / Massenspektrometrie

Exakte Arbeitsweise bei praktischer Arbeit und Dokumentation

Gute Englisch-Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Erfahrung im regulierten Umfeld (GxP / ISO) wäre super, ist aber nicht Voraussetzung

Das erwartet Dich bei uns

Messung pharmazeutischer Wirkstoffe in biologischen Proben mittels Immunoassay basierten oder LC-MS Methoden in einem GLP-zertifizierten Labor

Durchführung von (bio)analytischen Methodenvalidierungen sowie deren Anwendung in Rahmen von präklinischen und klinischen Studien inklusive Auswertung

Planung, Durchführung und Dokumentation von (bio)analytischen Prüfungen im Rahmen der Arzneimittelentwicklung

Organisatorische Aufgaben rund um das Labor

LC-MS Labor: Probenaufarbeitung inkl. Bedienung von LC-MS/MS Systemen und Durchführung von System-Tests

Noch Fragen? Dein Ansprechpartner Iris Rüttimann (HR Manager) steht Dir dafür gerne unter 043 355 7676 zur Verfügung.

Wäre das was für Dich? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen inkl. CV, Zeugnisse, Diplome, usw.
Show more

Planung, Durchführung und Dokumentation von (bio)analytischen Prüfungen im Rahmen der Arzneimittelentwicklung

Organisatorische Aufgaben rund um das Labor

LC-MS Labor: Probenaufarbeitung inkl. Bedienung von LC-MS/MS Systemen und Durchführung von System-Tests

Noch Fragen? Dein Ansprechpartner Iris Rüttimann (HR Manager) steht Dir dafür gerne unter 043 355 7676 zur Verfügung.

Wäre das was für Dich? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen inkl. CV, Zeugnisse, Diplome, usw.

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us with data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language. Experience with Data frame libraries (Polars, Pandas, Arrow, ...), and database toolkits (SQL Alchemy, ...).
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Knowledge of data engineering concepts and open-source ecosystem (Airflow, DBT, DuckDB, ...).
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Knowledge of semantic or hybrid search engines is a plus.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organizational skills. Desire to learn, explore, discover new concepts and technologies.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub


Show more

Title: Working Student in AI-Training/Model Evaluation (20%-100%)
Description:
Lightly AG is an ETH and HSG spin-off pioneering in machine learning and computer vision. Backed by Y Combinator and top-tier investors, our technology is used by global leaders in autonomous driving, medical imaging, and visual inspection.




We are looking for a working student to join our team as an AI Trainer, where your work helps improve the reliability and performance of AI systems. In this role, you’ll evaluate and refine AI-Models and their output, ensuring they meet quality standards, follow instructions, and respond appropriately to different contexts.




This is a great opportunity for a driven student who wants to gain hands-on experience in AI development while making a real contribution.


Tasks


In this role, you will:





Prompt-Response Evaluation: Assess if AI responses accurately address the prompt, follow instructions, and meet quality standards.


Language & Context Check: Judge the AI’s understanding of English, including grammar, tone, and ability to handle nuance or ambiguity.


Domain Relevance: Verify that responses fit within the expected domain (e.g., technical, general knowledge, conversational).


Instruction Following: Identify when the AI deviates from the prompt or adds irrelevant information.


Optional: If tasks involve visual outputs, check image accuracy and caption clarity (depending on project needs).



Requirements


You’re a strong candidate if you:





Excellent English skills (grammar, style, comprehension).


Strong attention to detail and ability to apply guidelines consistently.


Familiarity with AI and the use of LLMs.


Background in STEM, communications, education, or similar fields is a plus but not required.


Are available for at least 20% (ideally 60%).


Possess a valid work permit for Switzerland.





💡 Don’t meet every single requirement? That’s okay!




At Lightly, we believe in potential, growth, and learning. If you're excited about the role and think you could be a great fit, we encourage you to apply—even if your experience doesn’t match the job description 100%.


Benefits



Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment.


Career growth opportunities in a growing field of AI development and machine learning.


Flexible work hours, pensums and remote work options.





Send us your CV and a short note about why this role excites you. If you’ve handled similar tasks before, we’d love to hear specific examples.




We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Business Analyst IT
Description:
Depuis plus de 18 ans, nous accompagnons nos clients dans la réalisation de leurs ambitieux projets. Acteur de référence dans les domaines de l’informatique et de l’ingénierie, nous sommes présents dans plus de 50 villes et 8 pays.

Aujourd’hui, plus de 2600 Primers apportent conseils et expertises à nos quelques 300 clients.

En Suisse, situés à Genève, nous collaborons avec plusieurs clients grands comptes reconnus du marché. A travers une relation de confiance, nous contribuons au succès de leurs projets.




PrimeIT, always one step ahead !




Dans le cadre du renforcement de nos activités, et pour accompagner l’un de nos clients historiques, nous recherchons un/une :




Business Analyst IT




Votre mission :

Analyser les processus métiers au regard des contraintes techniques et opérationnelles afin de les automatiser (RPA) et les optimiser
Recueillir les exigences du Business, les prioriser et les traduire en spécifications fonctionnelles
Suivre les projets en assurant le rôle d'interface entre les métiers et les équipes techniques
Concevoir la stratégie de test, les cahiers de test, et superviser leur réalisation.
Participer à l'accompagnement au changement et à l'assistance utilisateur.
Veiller à la bonne rédaction de la documentation.




Votre profil :

Diplôme d’études supérieures.
Expérience de 5 ans minimum en tant que Business Analyst.
Expérience du secteur financier, idéalement du domaine du trading.
Maitrise des outils BPMN, UML, etc.
Maitrise du français et bon niveau d'anglais.




Ce que nous offrons :

Un cadre de travail stimulant et un accompagnement de proximité.
Un contrat à durée indéterminée dans le cadre d’une collaboration de long terme.
Une rémunération attractive associée à cinq semaines de congés payés.
Un plan de formation annuel complété par une plateforme e-learning en interne.




Informations pratiques :

Date de démarrage souhaitée : A convenir
Lieu de mission : Vaud




Intéressé par une nouvelle opportunité en Suisse ?

Transmettez-nous votre CV !

jobs@primeitconsulting.ch

Show more

Title: Consulente per la protezione dei dati
Description:
Ufficio federale di polizia fedpol, 80-100%, Berna

Il contributo che può dare


Fornire consulenza su questioni generali concernenti la protezione dei dati e su progetti e iniziative informatici
Fornire sostegno per l'integrazione dei requisiti in materia di protezione dei dati nei sistemi informatici, nello sviluppo di software e in altre soluzioni digitali
Allestire valutazioni d'impatto sulla protezione dei dati e valutazioni dei rischi nell'ambito di progetti e iniziative informatici
Elaborare pareri, direttive e promemoria su temi concernenti la protezione dei dati
Sensibilizzare sulle disposizioni in materia di protezione dei dati e sul loro impatto sui processi aziendali


Che cosa La contraddistingue


Laurea universitaria o diploma di scuola universitaria a livello di master in giurisprudenza o in una disciplina equivalente, idealmente con una pertinente formazione di base e continua nella protezione dei dati
Esperienza professionale con responsabilità analoga (protezione dei dati svizzera), idealmente in architetture e tecnologie informatiche, sviluppo di software ecc.
Orientamento alle soluzioni, capacità di trasmettere contenuti complessi in modo comprensibile (in forma orale e scritta), approccio analitico e digitale
Competenze di consulenza, assertività, capacità organizzative e spirito d'iniziativa
Ottime conoscenze di due lingue ufficiali


fedpol in azione per la Svizzera – sempre & ovunque

L'ambito direzionale Prevenzione della criminalità e diritto gestisce i centri di competenza per la compliance dei dati, il diritto, la prevenzione della criminalità e la lotta al riciclaggio di denaro (MROS).

La divisione Compliance dei dati presso fedpol garantisce il rispetto della protezione dei dati ed è responsabile del sistema di gestione della compliance dei dati di fedpol per i sistemi d'informazione di polizia.

Il settore Protezione dei dati fornisce consulenza a fedpol per le questioni concernenti il diritto in materia di protezione dei dati e la compliance dei dati.

Che cosa offriamo

Lavorare per la Svizzera: Ci adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.

Vivere la diversità: La concretizzazione delle pari opportunità ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.

In forma sul posto di lavoro: Forniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.

Parità salariale per un lavoro di uguale valore: Garantiamo la parità salariale e fissiamo la retribuzione in base alle prestazioni fornite, all'esperienza maturata e ai requisiti richiesti per un determinato posto di lavoro.

Conciliare lavoro e vita privata: Sosteniamo alle nostre collaboratrici e i nostri collaboratori nel realizzare i loro progetti di vita offrendo forme di lavoro flessibili e diversi modelli di orario di lavoro.

Prospettive professionali: Grazie a un'offerta di formazione e di formazione continua sempre aggiornata, promuoviamo lo sviluppo personale e professionale delle nostre collaboratrici e dei nostri collaboratori.

Informazioni complementari

Si prega di candidarsi tramite il nostro sistema di gestione delle candidature. A tal fine, cliccare su «Per candidarsi».

Title: ICT Data Analyst*in mit Schwerpunkt Power BI 80-100%
Description:
Zürich

Informatik

80% - 100%

Zur Erweiterung unseres Teams im Fachbereich Informatik suchen wir eine*n ICT Data Analyst*in mit Schwerpunkt Power BI

Stellenantritt: 1. November 2025 oder nach Vereinbarung

Ihre Aufgaben


Sie übernehmen den Aufbau einer modernen, cloudbasierten BI-Plattform mit Fokus auf Azure-Komponenten und stellen deren Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung sicher.
Sie sind verantwortlich für die Entwicklung und Pflege skalierbarer Power BI-Lösungen, die Sicherstellung von Datenqualität und Performence sowie für die technische Dokumentation und für Releases.
Sie führen komplexe Datananalysen zur Bereitstellung entscheidungsrelevanter Daten für die Fachbereiche sowie Ad-hoc-Auswertungen durch.
Sie unterstützen beim Aufbau einer Self-Service BI-Umgebung, beraten die Fachabteilungen und führen Schulungen durch.
Sie sind eng im Austausch mit Stakeholdern aus unterschiedlichen Bereichen und leiten kleinere Projekte oder Teilprojekte.


Ihr Profil


Ausbildung auf Niveau EFZ und abgeschlossene höhere Fachausbildung auf Niveau HFP wie beispielsweise ein Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder in Betriebswirtschaft mit Vertiefung Informatik
Weiterführende Weiterbildung ITIL Foundation
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst im Umfeld Power BI
Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Dashboards, Datenmodellen und automatisierten Datenpipelines
Know-how im Prozessmanagement und Freude an innovativen Ideen und Lösungen
Ausgeprägte Kunden- und Dienstleistungsorientierung
Überzeugendes Auftreten sowie ausgeprägte kommunikative Fähigkeiten


Wir bieten Ihnen


Ein verantwortungsvolles, vielseitiges und anspruchsvolles Aufgabengebiet in einem spannenden und dynamischen Umfeld
4-6 Wochen Ferien pro Jahr, je nach Alter und Funktionsstufe sowie zusätzliche 6 Betriebsferientage pro Jahr
Diverse Vergünstigungen, z.B. bei Mobility Carsharing, Mobile Abos und wahlweise einen Beitrag an die Verpflegungskosten (Lunch Checks)
Mobiles Arbeiten nach Möglichkeit
Sie profitieren von einer der besten Pensionskassen in Zürich und von einem individuellen Weiterbildungsangebot


Ihr Arbeitsort

Eggbühlstrasse 15, 8050 Zürich, Schweiz

Play

Pause

Ton aus

Zum Anfang
Show more

  • Diverse Vergünstigungen, z.B. bei Mobility Carsharing, Mobile Abos und wahlweise einen Beitrag an die Verpflegungskosten (Lunch Checks)
  • Mobiles Arbeiten nach Möglichkeit
  • Sie profitieren von einer der besten Pensionskassen in Zürich und von einem individuellen Weiterbildungsangebot

Ihr Arbeitsort

Eggbühlstrasse 15, 8050 Zürich, Schweiz

Play

Pause

Ton aus

Zum Anfang

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
We are looking for a Data Modeler to join our client, a leading financial institution in Zurich.




This is a contracting role with the initial duration until the end of 2026.




Key Responsibilities:

Capture and model data requirements, including data definitions, business rules, data quality standards, and logical data models.
Conduct impact assessments for application re-wiring by analyzing and mapping as-is vs. to-be data entities.
Design logical and physical data models following best practices to ensure high data quality and reduce redundancy.
Collaborate closely with the Chief Data Office and business stakeholders to map data entities to the Enterprise Data Catalog.
Work with development teams to implement data strategies, build data flows, and support the development of conceptual data models.




Required Skills & Experience:

Strong expertise in data-driven and integrated reference architectures, with solid knowledge of banking data products, financial data classification, and metadata management tools.
Experienced in agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, SAFe), data modeling standards and tools, and certified through relevant trainings.
Excellent business stakeholder management, cross-functional collaboration between IT and business, and the ability to navigate challenges under pressure with strong interpersonal skills.




Required languages:

English and German




If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Show more

Title: Data Historian
Description:
CLEEVEN is a European consulting group founded on two core convictions:

The excellence of European engineers must be a driver of global competitiveness
Our human mission is to support our consultants in their personal and professional development




As part of a major transformation project in the pharmaceutical industry, we are recruiting a Data Historian Engineer (Aveva PI) to strengthen our client’s industrial IT teams. The role will focus on designing, maintaining, and optimizing the Aveva PI solution to ensure reliable, compliant, and high-quality data management in validated GxP environments.




Role & Responsibilities :

Design, configure, and maintain data historian systems based on Aveva PI
Develop and optimize data models, interfaces, and tags to support production, quality, and compliance processes
Ensure seamless integration between Aveva PI, MES, SCADA, QMS, and other enterprise systems
Support validation and documentation activities in a GxP environment (CSV, audits, SOPs)
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to translate requirements into robust historian solutions
Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability and reliability
Train and support end users in leveraging historian data for reporting and analytics




Key Skills & Experience :

Proven experience with Aveva PI (OSIsoft PI System) in industrial or pharmaceutical contexts
Strong understanding of data historian data models and time-series data structures
Knowledge of integration with MES/SCADA/automation systems
Familiarity with GxP / CSV environments is a strong asset
Solid background in Windows Server, networking concepts, and industrial IT systems
Analytical mindset, ability to structure and document processes




Your Profile :

Engineering degree (IT, automation, data engineering) or equivalent experience
Fluent German (written and spoken) and professional English required
Strong communication skills with both technical teams and business users
Structured, detail-oriented, and solution-driven personality
Availability to work on-site in Switzerland (Basel area)




See you soon !

Show more

Title: Product Control Analyst
Description:
MET International AG (METI) was established in 2010 in order to consolidate and develop MET Group’s international natural gas sales and purchase portfolio, as well as to establish a trading arm for commodity lines.



METI is responsible for providing highly competitive supply structures to its gas and power sales affiliates, optimizing its power generation assets, managing the LNG portfolio, and trading around international positions.





Job Description


Production and supervision of the BAUs reporting cycle (P&L, exposures)
Daily interaction with Market Risk, Deal Validation and CFOs teams
Investigation of issues (e.g., booking, pricing) in Endur ETRM system impacting P&L and/or risk
Improve valuation methodology documents
Daily interaction with the 5 trading desks of METI, acting proactively to ensure the system or record ENDUR is up to date
Involvement in projects to enhance reporting systems and/or migrations, reconciling MTM’s and Deltas and understanding impacts of changes in methodology
Help shape and improve the PC management function and governance
Monitoring compliance with Risk management policies and any relevant operational policies which impact the P&L booking
Monitoring of breaches of Book ID and limits
Strong experience on financial and physical options, including Collar options, floor pricing, storages


Qualifications


Minimum 3+ years of experience in a Product Control, Risk, or Middle Office role within a trading environment, with a strong academic background in a related quantitative discipline, ACA/CIMA or CFA additionally advantageous
Strong understanding of valuation methodologies, P&L attribution, and reconciliation of MTM and Greeks
Proven exposure to physical optionality trading, particularly in renewable power and complex structured products (e.g., storage, collars, floor pricing); ability to understand the embedded optionality and its impact on risk/P&L
Technical experience with SQL, Power BI, VBA and Python is highly advantageous
Deep knowledge of the Endur ETRM system is advantageous or other, including deal booking, pricing, and front-to-back data flows
Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally with trading desks, Risk, CFOs, and Back Office to resolve booking or valuation issues
Hands-on experience with SQL for data extraction, reconciliation, and analysis to support reporting and investigations
Analytical, detail-oriented, and proactive, with a strong focus on governance, compliance, and process improvement initiative


Additional Information


An international environment and workforce with ca. 60 nationalities, with a commitment to respect, diversity and integrity
Career growth and development at one of Switzerland's Top Employers
Highly competitive remuneration system, above-market earning potential via our unique performance-based bonus schemes, reflecting the value we place on dedication and results
Work in a flat organizational structure with best-in-class industry experts, promoting individual ideas, rapid decision-making, and high accountability
A rapidly growing company entering new markets globally and expanding its asset portfolio worldwide, with substantial investment into green energy (renewables) assets
Benefit from international career opportunities and internal mobility within our 17 globally located offices
Engaging annual company events, from group-level teambuilding to local entity events and festive celebrations
Show more
